Reviews.Title: “Nice place but breakfast......”
Reviews.Author: CAPTAINCURRY
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed here for 3 nights, stayed in 406 Room was nice and clean, but small and shower was slightly iffy hot n cold randomly. The staff were friendly and attentive, we did get a problem at breakfast, at 9 am most guests went to dine but as not lots of tables, we had to wait around a while. If your an early bird all will be fine. Also the breakfast is included to a point, basic items are free but if u want boild egg or omlette cooked, its extra, bread hams cheese cereal was free. Didnt see anyone buying extras at brekky. Venice was ok, we had hoped would be less touristy, was very busy and gondeliers wanted â‚¬100 euro for a 30 min ride. St marks square is a rip off, dont do it unless you like paying â‚¬12 for a beer or â‚¬9 for a coke, that was cheaper bar! Plus theres loads of pigeons! It was a good place but doubt venice will be on the go back there schedule.

Reviews.Title: “quality small hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: travelhoundIndia
Reviews.Content: The front desk is located just inside the main doors. There was another couple registering when we arrived and since there was not enough room for all four of us to fit comfortably in the front desk area, we waited outside. The hotel is surrounded by a lovely area where many sidewalk vendors set up shop and lovers stroll past or linger alongside the quay. It is not, however, centrally located as many of the Venetian hot spots require an effort to reach. I didn't mind this fact as I enjoyed exploring a place but my wife felt our hotel location was too isolated. We had a corner room with water views and it helped offset the smallness of the room. There is good use of the space, however, with ample room for storage and all comforts. The Hotel staff were consistently friendly and professional. The hotel arranged a private water taxi ($100) for us to get back to the airport, which made in much easier to deal with our 4 pieces of luggage plus hand bags.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Family”
Reviews.Author: Domer84
Reviews.Content: I can only reiterate what so many other guests at Hotel Bucintoro have written. We had visited Venice twice before this trip, and had a good idea of what to expect in terms of location and access to the major sites (the #41 vaporetto leaving the train station is typically ignored by tourists who want to go down the Grand Canal, but this line takes half the time, is less crowded and drops you off about 100 yards from the front door of the hotel... and it doesn't get easier than that in Venice unless you hire a private water taxi!). However, we had no way of knowing how well appointed this hotel would be, or how well we would be treated by the staff... and I do mean everyone from the front desk managers to the house keeper to the host at breakfast. They welcomed us warmly, quickly learned our interests and preferences, and offered excellent recommendations for dining, shopping and site seeing. In fact I had researched what I thought were some of the best restaurants in the city, but the front desk booked us at two restaurants during our stay that were far better than anything I had found online. By the time we left we felt like we were saying goodbye to family. I could find no fault with any part of our stay at Hotel Bucintoro, and would recommend it highly to anyone visiting Venice for the first time or coming back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: sandjnick
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the water taxi, Hotel Bucintoro exceeded all expectations. From a visual perspective it was both beautiful and romantic. Once we entered the hotel, our experience went to a different level. We were greeted like old friends returning, everyone in the hotel staff were genuinely pleased to offer any assistance without being over the top. Our room was on the 2nd floor, with breathtaking views of the grand canal and beyond. It was clean, comfortable, with tea and coffee making facilities as well as a generous mini-bar with ALL prices clearly stated. The room was serviced everyday, with clean towels/bed linen. Service was impeccable, facilities outstanding. This was our first trip to Venice, and it will not be our last. If you want to feel Venice's hospitality at its best, then this is the place to go, you are not treated like just another tourist. Many thanks to Edith, Giancarlo and ALL the hotel staff for a very memorable stay, see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georges-mummy06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our first trip to Venice, the hotel was easy to find, staff were very helpful and attentive, the view from our room was Amazing!! However on the down side the room was small but clean and nicely decorated. There were no tea or coffee making facilities, but you can get that at any time in the hotel, and the t.v was all Italian not that i like to watch much but do like to keep up to date with the news whilst away. I would definately go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Must be one of the best hotels in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Jean A
Reviews.Content: The pre- arrival guidance on tours, water taxis, etc was above and beyond the usual to be expected. Our room was right at the top of the hotel and the views were breathtaking. Housekeeping services were exemplary and all in all our first stay in Venice was wonderful. Well done Bucintoro - I hope we will return sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Trip”
Reviews.Author: JPOS_CA
Reviews.Content: Ironically my wife and I stayed at this hotel back in 1999 when we were looking for a value gem and it met all of our needs. Going back in 2012, with our two children (how things change!) we were so excited to hear that it has been recently been redone into a luxury, 4 star property. The View: This hotel is on the lagoon and next to one of the canals. The views are amazing from each room. Basta. The Location: 5 minute walk from the Arsenale water taxi stop, 10 minutes to Saint Markâ€™s Square. Also the area around the hotel, in the Castello neighborhood, offered a more local flavor of shops, wine bars and restaurants. Close enough to all of the Venice sights, but then removed from the throngs of people in the afternoon, evening. The Rooms: We had an outstanding stay and were able to secure the â€œfamily suiteâ€� which is two adjoining rooms (305-306) and provided one larger room with a small sitting area and then a slightly smaller, standard room. Together it provided a very healthy amount of space (especially in Venice) and two bathrooms. The rooms were beautifully appointed and beds very comfortable. The bathrooms were very nice, but the water pressure had a bit to be desired â€“ but hey â€“ you are in Venice! The Service: Was top notch. It feels like a small, family run hotel as we only dealt with 5 people over our 3 days and each was friendly, helpful and offered suggestions and information on any questions we had. We loved Stefan! Breakfast: the food provided was very good and typical quality, continental fair. Fresh baked roles, cereals, juice, fruit, yogurt, cold ham, turkey and cheese. Included are great espresso based drinks, tea and coffee. For a reasonable additional cost, hot options were available. A rare gem in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and views.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller095
Reviews.Content: This upscale hotel is on the waterfront and 10 minute walk from St. Mark Square and Doge's Palace. Hotel and rooms are beautiful, perfectly maintained and have spectular views. Service was spectacular. Continental breakfast included. We took the train to San Lucia train station and got line 1 water bus right in front of the train station. Get off at Arsenale station, walk over 1 bridge (not easy to get luggage up and down those stairs, but only 1 bridge away from a hotel is VERY close for Venice) and hotel is right there. For airport, take Alilaguna ferry (blue line) from Arsenale station right by the hotel. Ticket cost e16. Alilaguna ferry has very few stops, so another reason to choose Hotel Bucintoro which is right at a stop. Hotel offers free Murano glass tour with free taxi transport. We enjoyed it and did not find the 'hard sell' others mentioned in their comments. Free internet in lobby area. We had 2 people in the room, but it could easily take 3. We mentioned the trip advisor 'special offer' and got a beautifully delivered free bottle of prosecco. Look for the special offer underneath the hotel name on this trip advisor page to see if the offer is still on!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: bob63_10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfectly placed, less than 10 minutes walk from San Marco - but out of the noisy crowd - right in front of St George Island along Riva degli Schiavoni. The staff is nice and efficient, ready to help with a smile if you have messed up the TV channels or need three wifi access codes for your Apple family. The room is small but clean, all covered in dark wood like a ship's cabin, and there are so many nice little amenities in the bathroom. And finally you open the window.. and there the city lies along Riva degli Schiavoni, with the tall Campanile di San Marco on one side of the Canal Grande and the Basilica del Redentore on the other. A Tripadvisor reward letter is proudly shown in the small lobby, but when I noticed it they simply said: "we just work at our best, like we've being doing from long before". Smiling, again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pMacDo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as good as everyone else says it is.Helpful staff, excellent breakfast choice, ideal location. As a tip, I'd say turn left out of the hotel, walk to Via Garibaldi and exolore the local area. As vegetarians, my daughter and I ate lots of pizza. For this can recommend Dai Tosi,Secco Marina 738 and Da Paolo 2389 Campo dell'Arsenale, both within easy walking distance of the hotel. Also recommend going to the Co-op on Via Garibaldi at lunchtime and buying picnic food to eat in the gardens opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WaukeshaHome
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Venice before and my expectations were very high. The staff at Hotel Bucintoro seemed to understand this was a special trip and were so incredibly friendly and helpful and lovely. Venice is obviously amazing, but having my junior suite as an escape from the crowds was delightful. The location is a little out of the way so you can enjoy the walk to San Marco (or most anywhere) and the Arsenale stop is wildly convenient for the vaparettos and the Alilaguna. I could open my windows to hear the waves and boats in the evenings and random musicians and children laughing in the day. Breakfast, service, decor, bathrooms, toiletries were all impecable. Even the pillows were among the most comfortable I've ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma E
Reviews.Content: We visted Venice this February, I booked the Hotel Bucintoro and couldn't have been more impressed. The location is excellent and anyone travelling by water bus from the airport should depart at the 'Arsenale' stop, this is a 2 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated, with breath taking views and very clean. The breakfast is continental and staff very friendly. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from St Marks square where all the main attractions lie. We travelled with our 1 year old daughter and the hotel catered for her every need. We stayed in a standard room which was a lovely size (considering we had to have a cot) and an amazing view of the canel right up to St Marks Square. Overall couldn't fault at all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, small rooms, but excellent”
Reviews.Author: WelshwizardK10D
Reviews.Content: Location - about 11 minutes and 7 -8 bridges from St Mark's. Near the Airportbus stop at Arsenale, far enough away from the crowds but not too near. Grand view of the city from our room. Room size - a little on the small side but well appointed and a very comfortable bed. Quiet. Service - who said Venetian Concierges were rude? Ours were personable and knowlegdable, and extremely polite and welcoming. A true credit to the hotel. Breakfast - very good. Dinner recommendations were spot on. Certainly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to Venice”
Reviews.Author: wstphl
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 nights at Christmas,and the hotel was a wonderful respite from the wet weather and high tides. A beautiful place with great views, and an elegant breakfast. As others have said , the water taxis and other attractions are very close. Ask for the 'free' taxi to the Murano glass factory, it is worth the sales pitch. Being there in the off season offered so many advantages, besides the rates, we often strolled down deserted alleys to find wonderful quiet restaurants, where we were treated as family. Something that doesn't happen in season. And you can take a train to almost anywhere in europe, which we did. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “It Doesn't Get Better than the Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: LaurenC338
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 daughters and I stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro during the Christmas holiday and we loved everything about the place--the views, the beautifully decorated rooms, the wonderful breakfast, the location near some of Venice's best restaurants (Al Covo was our favorite). But what made this place really special was the truly caring staff. My 12-year-old's favorite stuffed animal got mixed up with the linen a few days before we checked out. The hotel staffed searched high and low for it, located it at the laundry after we had left, and sent it back to us. It arrived today. My daughter burst into tears of joy to see it again! That was above and beyond, and we all thank you for a memorable stay and your truly excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraKopyciok
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro in February this year. We had an amazing time not least because we had such a fabulous hotel. I have been to Venice 3 times previously and Hotel Bucintoro is the best I have stayed in- it's location is perfect- it is just far enough away from the touristy crowds of Piazza San Marco but close enough that you could walk it in 10-15 minutes. It is also one bridge across from the Arsenale Vaporetto stop and one bridge in the other direction from Via Garibaldi a great street filled with fantastic Trattoria's and Osteria's along with some intimate bacaro filled with locals. Our room itself was comfortable and spacious and decorated to an extremely high standard. We had a lovely view looking straight out to The Basilica and St Marks (rm 201). The bathroom was beautiful and elegant and the rain shower-head was lovely! The heating was easy to work in the room and was much needed and appreciated most days due to the extreme cold outside. We only had one minor issue with the plug in our bathroom sink, we told the hotel before we had breakfast one morning and by the time we went back up to our room- less than 45 minutes later it had been fixed. The breakfast itself was lovely. There was a great amount of choice and was one of the best continental breakfasts I have ever had in a European hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and only too happy to help. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice for last year's Carnevale and Bucintoro proved to be perfect for the occasion. It's virtually in front of the Arsenale stop so very easy to find. San Marco is only minutes away yet it is in the Castello district where I appreciated the quiet to recharge away from the madness of the more touristy areas. My suite was basically a large room for Venice. The porthole shaped window looked out to the grand canal, which is a distinctive feature on the exterior of the hotel. Service was excellent and as was the typical Italian continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but few improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: faylouise30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bucintoro for a long weekend in January. Overall, I would recommend as it is in a great location (really close to the ferry drop off) and has lovely views. With a few improvements, I would give it a higher mark. The rooms were clean and tidy but extremely small. We have stayed in a lot of hotels all over Italy but these were definitely the smallest. The decor was nice- decorated like the inside of cabins. It would have been nice to have the housekeeping staff turn down the beds at night whilst we were out (this only happened during the day). The bathroom could do with a few improvements. The shower was not powerful at all and there was no bath which would have been a nice addition. Bathrobes would also have been nice. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed the breakfast which was continental (selection of lovely croissants, cakes, boiled eggs, meats, breads etc) but my husband would have preferred a selection of hot items too. You could pay extra, i think 6 euros for scrambled eggs, but this would have been nice to have been included. Overall, we enjoyed Venice- would recommend a visit to the Dogges Palace and Peggy Guigenheim gallery- and definitely a gondola ride (although pricey, we paid 80 euros). We enjoyed some nice meals, lovely seafood, but again very expensive. We loved the coffee bars and the great selection of chocolate and cakes they offered and try the spritz drink that Venecians drink, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Br00klynm0m
Reviews.Content: An exquisite, small hotel with wonderful views of San Marco and the Grand Canal. I loved the high-style, ship-like decor: compact rooms with shiny wood panelling and clever built-ins. The breakfast room was lovely. Tiny lounge off the equally tiny lobby, though in summer you'd want to have your drink outside. It's reassuring to know that no matter how lost you get searching for this scuola or that trattoria, you can easily find your way back to Bucintoro. Just follow the quai down from San Marco just past Aresenale. Go just beyond the hotel and you come to the wonderfully residential Castello district. Although internet is free, one is required to get a new and very long password every day, a separate one for each device.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with a Great View”
Reviews.Author: daudratul
Reviews.Content: To feel the ancient venice in you room, to have a great view of the harbor and to visit the St.marcos with few steps, this hotel offers the best. The rooms are elegant and the interion of the hotel definitely gives the smell of maritime venice. The rooms are really clean with all the up in the clss amenities. The buffet breakfast can serve delicacy of every taste. Their coffee with milk (cafee latte) is really memorable. There are many good restaurants in shorter distance but like all other things in venice, the food is also overpriced. The staffs are very friendly and welcoming to extend their help. The view from the room was really excellent specially during the night. Would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Hotel for your stay in Venice with the most superb views”
Reviews.Author: sherman3110
Reviews.Content: This hotel is location conveniently a minutes walk from Arsenale Vaporetto stop and enjoys the most enviable views across the Lagoon and down the Grand Canal from every bedroom window. The hotel itself is in immaculate condition with a very comfortable Bar/Breakfast Room, a small Reading/Internet Room and well lit common parts. There is a speedy lift and all areas seem very 'accessible'. The Bedroom we were given was on the first floor and was extremely comfortable and well equipt. The Bedroom had a flat screen tv, telephone, two windows overlooking the Canal as well as the twin beds and bedside tables.The Dressing Area had a desk and excellent range of wardrobes, one of which houses a minibar and the ensuite Bathroom was clad in marble with hi tech shower/bath facilities. The whole space would be very suitable for someone with wheelchair use. Overall the decorations are contemporary with a nautical theme in terms of polished wood panelling and colours. The Breakfast served gave ample choice with a cold buffet available on a help yourself basis and hot meals to order separately. Reception couldn't have been more helpful and wifi was free. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, wonderful staff, perfect view.”
Reviews.Author: SergioMcGreg
Reviews.Content: Difficult to add anything to what has been already said about Bucintoro. We absolutely had a fantastic experience. From the moment we made our first call to them to check avialability to the moment we left. A special mention to Giancarlo who made sure we had a consistent personalised experience during all our stay. The rest of the staff was also very good. The view from the rooms is stunning. Also consider that Bucintoro Hotel is in a unique location. Most (if not all) of the hotels have only laguna view when Bucintoro is in a perfect seaside corner and many of its rooms are facing towards St Mark's campanile. Its distance from St.Mark's square is easily done by foot and with the new ramps installed possibly even by weelchair.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: jjr1957
Reviews.Content: For the second time I stayed at the Bucintoro Hotel in Venice. I can't imagine a beter place, the hotel being central, quiet and the view fantastic. Beds are very comfortable and so are all the rooms amenities. About the staff, Stephano and Giancarlo will do anything to make your stay unforgettable with the kindest friendlyness. My best experience ever in a long life of travel around the world. Jean-Jacques Ravel from Paris

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cicero3
Reviews.Content: I stayed im this hotels for 3 nights in december The location is convenient, near place san marco. And directly on the sea. The rooms are very nicely decorated . There is some green marble on the floor and walls of the bathroom giving it a luxurious feel. The size of the room is ok, i was on the third floor and the room had a high ceiling, the bathroom is quite small. However there was a lot of light and you never feel claustrophobic. After reading many negative reviews of hotels in Venice i was a bit woried. So i was quite impressed by the very clean and well decorated room. I paid around 130 $ for one double room and i feel that this hotel offers great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the 2nd part of our honeymoon. The rooms are decorated in the style of an expensive tall ship cabin and are beautiful and clean. We had a great view towards St Mark's Square and the lagoon on the 2nd floor. The rooms were very quite, we didn't really hear any noise from other guests or from outside as the hotel is just that little bit away from the main tourist parts of Venice, but in very easy and open walking distance. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was good for me, but my husband would have preferred more of a selection. The location of the hotel is very good, less than 10 minutes walk from St Mark's Square. There is a vapretto stop (Arsenale) seconds away from the front of the hotel. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanrose
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good with a wonderful view of the lagoon. Clean, modern, and accessible to all. The front desk was helpful and responsive. Negatives: Breakfast quality could be improved. Tended to run out of food, which was not replaced as the morning progressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: babymummy1
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this well kept excellently located hotel in September The staff were helpfull and very polite ( a reareity in Venice) The room was well serviced and had great views on to the grand canal a real bonus for my four year old who was blown away by Venice The room had a little area for his bed The choccies at bed time were a nice touch Breakfast was good Lots of choice But the price for this kind of value in one of the most expensive cities in Europe was unbeatable We would return without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: AussieBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be one of the best in Venice. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, bathrooms lovely, and the outlook to the lagoon is gorgeous. Breakfast is provided in a gorgeous room on the ground floor overlooking the lagoon, wonderful selection for a hotel without a restaurant. Lots of restaurants only 2 mins away, and St Marks Square is less than 10 mins walk also. Found a great restaurant next to the Rialto bridge today too called Saracena, had a great carbonara!

Reviews.Title: “Venice's best kept secret Hotel Bocintoro”
Reviews.Author: Killara69
Reviews.Content: Not enough stars to express this hotels excellence, forget tight little rooms off narrow alleys even on the Grand Canal. This Hotel Bucintoro is 5 minutes walk from Piazza san Marco with beautiful open views from every room over the lagoon and/or san Marco.Well fitted, clean rooms, excellent bathrooms and a great breakfast to start your day. Better even than all this are the staff, willing, informed, friendly and always happy to fulfill special needs. We most especially want to thank Giuliano and Edith.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: edgarsz
Reviews.Content: This is a very good (and expensive) luxury hotel in a very good location in Venice. It is located in the Castello neighborhood near the â€œArsenalâ€� stop of both the vaporetto (the water bus) and the â€œblue lineâ€� boat from the airport. That means that you can reach it from the Airport or the train and bus stations or the parking areas by public transport without having to change. If you have luggage this is significant. From the â€œArsenalâ€� stop to the hotel it is a 3 minutes walk. If your luggage is heavy and you are old and/or weak, take into account that you have to cross a bridge, better ask the hotel to meet you at the vaporetto stop. This location is central, you can walk to St. Mark in 10 minutes, or travel 1 stop on the vaporetto, but free from the multitude of tourists that invade the area between St.Mark and Rialto during most of the day. There are restaurants and shops next door The vaporetto will take you everywhere, service is frequent and convenient. If you plan to use it it is worth buying a 12 or 24 hour unlimited pass for 16/18 euro. Rooms are on the smaller side but very confortable and the view from the window is unsurpassable. Breakfast is fine and there is free internet in the room. Staff is knowledgeable and helpful

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Wendy L
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro Hotel for 5 nights in November; the hotel is absolutely a hidden gem in Venice. The location and the views from the room are unbeatable. A stop for Alilaguna & water bus (actv) is just 3 minutes away from the hotel. All staffs are friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and attention to details, you donâ€™t need to worry about anything even if you are a first timer to Venice. The water taxi ride is one of the greatest highlight during our stay; donâ€™t worry about the cost, it is an added value to your stay. This is the hotel which I will highly recommended to all if you are planning on your next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Venice for the first part of our honeymoon earlier this month and were absolutely delighted with Hotel Bucintoro, for the hotel itself, the staff and the location. Their recommendations for local restaurants were also spot on. We fully intend to stay there again when we're next in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for here”
Reviews.Author: Flagpies09
Reviews.Content: Yes it's expensive, but if you're sick of 100 Euro a night one star shoe boxes, this place could be just what you're looking for. My wife and I stayed here by default, as pretty much everywhere else I tried to book was full. We knew the hotel had a nice outlook, but couldn't have imagined how nice it was. You don't overlook a canal, but that's fine... overlooking the lagoon makes up for it. Although they offered us a 'free' trip to Murano, we were ushered through the workshop very quickly and into an extremely expensive shop. The hard sell soon commenced and in all honesty, this pissed me off. If you're good at saying no 100 times in a row to borderline pushy sales people though (or have a love for exquisite Murano glass), then you may well enjoy it. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and kind... in fact everything to do with the hotel was amazing -- service, comfort and breakfast. Not too far from a nice park (rare in Venice) and local markets for basics like bread, wine and fruit. Would have rated the place five stars if not for the Murano visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, incredibly helpful staff and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: fairsyd
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. The location was great being located on the grand canal, short walk to St Mark's Square, Vaporetto stop right near the hotel, all rooms overlook the Grand Canal and good value restaurants just around the corner on Via Garibaldi which are a bit away from the tourist zone with locals eating there. The front desk staff, in particular Stefano, went out of their way to help. We strongly recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Kentishlady49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights towards the end of September and loved this hotel. It is a short (10 mins max) walk from San Marco so close to everything but a lovely retreat from the madding crowds at the end of a busy day. Great views over the lagoon and very helpful and friendly staff - would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous location with staff to match”
Reviews.Author: DAWINIAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spacious room which had a really lovely view back towards the Grand Canal and a window large enough to appreciate it. The Bucintoro was quiet, clean and very well located - an easy walk to St Marks and within a few steps of Arsenale Vaporetto stop. From the station the 4.2 route is faster but misses out the Grand Canal - so if you have time take the 1 to get the full effect of Venice on your way in. The staff were very pleasant and helped us find a well priced local option for dinner. Breakfast was fresh and there was plenty of choice. Just misses out on excellent though because there was no effective temperature control on the shower - hot or hot.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bucintoro in early October for three nights. This hotel is immaculate, staff very friendly and most helpful. We had the rooftop room, which was not large but had a private roof top deck, and as the weather was warm during the day, it was a perfect place to view the waterfront activities away from the crowds. A short walk to St Mark's, this hotel provides a serene refuge from the tourist areas. Highly recommend a stay here. As an aside, the breakfast buffet was offered many choices, very complete.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible view!”
Reviews.Author: JackH0
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent a romantic weekend at this hotel at the end of Sept.,an excellent stay started from the very beginning because we got a free room upgrade...ours was a corner room with an astonishing view on the lagoon and the close isles plus Saint Mark's Square.It is a very quiet hotel close to a water bus stop nearly in front of the hotel's main entrance in a very easy walking distance to the major spots of interest-more or less six minutes by walk from Saint Mark-and yet far from the hassle of the tourist area,close to a natural park and a street -Via Garribaldi-full of useful shops,a bank with an ATM,some cheap restaurants and an excellent ice cream shop.The lobby is small but truly elegant,the whole hotel is decorated in naval style like if it was a ship.The view from our room was simply breathtaking..we left our windows open due to the warm temperatures but by night it was incredibly quiet.We relied on the advices given us by the cool front office manager by name Stefano but we found each member of the staff truly polite and helpful,speaking an excellent English as well as other foreign languages.The hotel has a pretty breakfast room,a free Wi-fi connection in room,a working a/c...in our good size room,the extra clean bathroom was in red marble,we had enough room to store our luggage,a comfortable large bed,a flat screen Tv with various channels..a delightful stay in a perfect hotel we strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Donald L
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel and would recommend it highly. The rooms are not large but they are very clean and the location is outstanding. It has great views of the bay. Only a short walk from the center of Venice but out of the noisy busy tourist area. Had breakfast in the room twice which was nice (small extra cost). Overall good value for Venice which is expensive. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Changed a few dollars for euros here at a rate not far off the Change Bureaus and a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Service”
Reviews.Author: AAndTMD
Reviews.Content: As said by many others, the hotel is in a great location. Right on the water, and away from the throngs at St. Marks. I'd have to disagree with complaints about the service; we found everyone to be helpful and accomodating. They had a nice breakfast area, and the food was good (you have to pay a little extra for eggs but really very reasonable). Internet is included, which is also a major plus! The main problem the hotel has is the facility itself. Yes, the rooms are small and that is expected. Beds are a bit hard but that is personal preference. The major problem is that the bathroom had a significant mold smell to it, to the point where we really kept the windows open all the time and the bathroom door closed. I am not sure whether this is a problem with all rooms, or just the one we were in. So to summarize, the staff was all 5 star, the facility brings them down a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrahay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, very clean, bright and ideally located. The rooms are not big, but that wasn't important to us. We had a great room with a full view of the Grand Canal. It was the perfect way to wrap up our trip to Italy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Marion M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location with a view that could not be beat. The staff was helpful with all information and recommended a wonderful restaurant and Vivaldi concert during our stay. The room was well appointed and the decor was that of being on a shop with warm woods and bronze details.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: canadiantravelnuts
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in early October. The location is great - slightly away from the crowds of St Marks. The room was strictly utilitarian and cramped. As is common in Italy the matress was rock hard. The view is nice but only out of a small window if you stand in front of it. The main concierge was quite pushy. We went to their recommended restaurant the first night and it was good. Following nights when trying to get help with reservations he kept trying to get us to go back to the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Donna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for our trip to Venice. 10 mins walk to Saint Marks Square. 150m away from vaporetto to Airport, Bus terminal, Saint Marks, Rialto, Murano etc. Staff are very polite and knowledgeable. Rooms were spacious (family room ) and very clean. Views over canal and up to St Marks. Breakfast was continental (with option to pay for omelettes,bacon, eggs etc Would recommend hotel to suit all travellers. Very quiet and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArtFrog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel for both business and vacation. The hotel's location was perfect as it was just far enough away from the heavy crowds to be relaxing, but still on the lagoon for a great view and within easy walking distance to St. Mark's Square. Also, it was literally at the Biennale and Arsenale which made visiting the exhibitions very easy. Stefano graciously took care of all our requests and was in constant email contact before our trip to make arrangements. All of the other staff were fantastic and helpful as well. My husband had to be at a conference daily on La Giudecca and Stefano made sure he knew how to get there easily with the vapporetto and it was not a problem at all. One of the best tips was having Stefano arrange a water taxi to and from the airport. It made the trip so relaxing and gave great impressions of the city. Our room and bed were very comfortable and extremely clean. I would absolutely stay there again and am so thankful that the staff made our trip so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful venice”
Reviews.Author: DafTrueblue
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro is just an ideal base for exploring venice, facing San Marco Docks and a short stroll to Piazza San Marco! My wife and I just had a magical time in venice, this being our third visit but the first time we stopped over and we couldn`t have chosen a better hotel. Once checked in and showen to our room it felt that bit special. The room was just so perfect, fitted out in elegant wood paneling and oil burning lamps, and then on opening the shutters on the windows the view was amazing! The only dissapointment was that they had no restaurant and thats the only reason I rated very good and not excellent! Breakfast very good, go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great location; great view”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravelworld
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Had a pretty large room with view over the lagoon. Nice bars just around the corner in Via Garibaldi (for the nightly "Spritz"). It's close walking distance to San Marco. It's also near the Aresenale vaporetto stop (for trips to/from airport or around the city, or to Murano etc.) The hotel had also a very nice breakfast. If you are ok with a somewhat simpler room and breakfast, but with an even better view, try "A Tribute to Music" where we also stayed for a few nights, for about 1/3 less of the price. It's even closer to San Marco, on the other side of the Aresenale vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timiny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there in October. The hotel is beautiful, in a nice, quieter part of Venice, with great views. Easy to get to from the Arsenale mooring. The rooms are small, but well done. Very nice dark wood and marble everything. The staff is also very nice and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Lakey171
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great location. The rooms are well equipped in a naval style with a great view over the lagoon. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Was recommended by a friend and would not hesitate to recommend to anyone else wishing to visit venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Roger_50_11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic views over canal to watch cruise ships go by. Lovely quiet area within walking distance to the action. Helpful staff with great complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: itsallu
Reviews.Content: We choose this location for our 10yr anniversary. I spent hours reviewing the ideal hotel for our first trip to Venice and finally settled on this location. We stayed here for 3 nights before transferring to a cruise. The rates strongly correlate to the experience you'll receive here. The staff are all top-notch. The decor of the establishment is phenomenal and the location in Arsenal became one of the best surprises. It was quiet and away from the hustle at San Marco and other locations. The bus terminal was a short stroll away. The best treat was venturing off through the neighborhoods and meeting the locals. Each morning we awoke, on the third floor, to the aroma of breakfast. The meal was light, healthy and the ideal choice. It included pastries, meat&cheese-spread, boiled eggs, and fruits. The pastries and coffee were delicious. I enjoyed kick starting the day with a morning run along the grand canal without any interference. During thurs-saturday you can enjoy watching the yachts and massive cruise ships come into port during the morning. Our room was on the third floor and looked east towards San Marco. I would argue it was the best view in the house. We left the windows open at night for the fresh air. The only negative comment are the clunking water-buses when they dock at night. We slept through it easy enough between the red-eye flight and pure exhaustion exploring Venice. Check it out - you'll enjoy the story and experience that you can share back home. Thanks to the hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bucintoro - perfect hotel in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Barbara366
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise the Hotel Bucintoro was - it's position close to The Arsenale is absolutely perfect. With a view of the Capanile and within 5 mins walk of St Marks's Square, yet wonderfully quiet and away from the crowds. We were thrilled with our room and amazed when we opened the bedroom window and saw the view - wow, has to be one of the best views form any hotel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleyDick
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadviser I booked this hotel for our first visit to Venice. I am so glad I did. From the moment we stepped through the door we were treated with the utmost friendly, efficient and attentive service from everyone. We were in Room 205 which was the most gorgeous junior suite we have stayed in anywhere with a view of the lagoon to die for. The breakfast was extremely comprehensive with something for everyones taste and served by the most charming waitresses. Anything we required was immediately sent to our room and no request was too much trouble for them. The hotel is so convenient for St Marks Square but is away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds. A genuine haven. Sitting drinking a glass of wine with the sun setting over the lagoon and a cruise ship passing by is my idea of heaven. If it's yours then you should really book this hotel NOW. However I don't want it to become so popular I won't be able to get a room next time I visit Venice. !! Thank you to all the staff for making our holiday so wonderful. Les & Lesley Dick

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: euro1013
Reviews.Content: We (My wife and myself) checked in on 09/06 for 3 nights. We were given room #406. We put our bags, had a quick wash and left the hotel. Before heading out we asked the concierge (not sure of his name, but he is an older man and apparently the manager too) for some recommendations for quick bite as well for dinner and anything interesting that we should do in Venice over 3 days. His verbatim response for food was "everything is good around here, you can walk to the left or right of the hotel". Quite a similar response for sightseeing..."you should walk around and take a look yourself" and he handed us the map. We felt it was quite weird since we had a great experience in Florence from where we just landed. We came back a few hours later and I went in to take a shower. I kept the shower on cold and it started with luke warm water. I thought it would adjust the temperature, though it kept increasing the water temperature to a limit that it was boiling and i had to rush out of the shower. Called the concierge and was told the manager will only be available next day AM and decide the course of action. I was almost burnt, wife had yet to take a shower and the guy did not care at all. I asked him if we can be moved to another room , answer was "we are completely booked". Weird because we saw couple of people checking out when we came back to the hotel. I asked if he could call the manager on his cell and find out what options are available, the answer was "the manager cannot be reached under any circumstances once he leaves and any guest issues can only be addressed in the AM" the time that I was having this discussion was 5:30 PM. Apparently i believe the manager leaves around 3 PM and comes back next day at 7:30 AM. The curt and rude responses by this hotel staff were shocking to say the least. I was told that the manager/concierge will be back at 7:30 AM and will immediately look into our issue. We woke up at 8:45 AM and there was no call from the manager. We stepped down and asked the manager as to what corrective action is being taken. There was no apology at all, the response was " we are totally booked and can have a another room only by noon." We came back in the afternoon and they moved us to room # 303, which was way smaller than the prior room. I checked the bathroom functions and yes the water temperature was fine but the so-called rain shower was slow as a trickle. On being questioned about the size, the response was "its a similar room." The shocking piece is that these guys cannot get their act together with only a 20 room hotel. Also, even more shocking is that this was a 2011 Trip Advisor European favorite!! We travel every year to Europe and have been to Switzerland, Spain, UK, Scotland, France, Belgium, and have never come across this kind of customer service. It was like there was a purpose it served for them to frustrate us. Pros: breakfast buffet and location. Also, the room are not mosquito free!!! The reason is right before you enter the hotel on the left there is a plant and in the evening it becomes a mosquito heaven!! One would literally have to duck around to enter the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in a city packed with tourists”
Reviews.Author: Guy_WoodCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice small hotel with excellent views over the water and away from the noise of the Grand Canal. It is very close to a Vaporetto stop and this means that you are able to go anywhere in the city with ease. The room was bright, clean and comfortable. Service was excellent from the moment we arrived until our departure 3 days later. The breakfast area is small and if timing is off you may have to wait for a table. This only happened once and is not a big deal if you allow yourself and extra 15 minutes, just in case. If we return to Venice we know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bucintoro, Venice”
Reviews.Author: MrsStevens91011
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel. It was close enough to the square to walk but far enough away from the madness. The view was fantastic. I only wish our window didnt have the street lamp directly outside it, while the curtains were fairly good at blocking it out, it did seep in a little around the edges with a all-night "glow!" Love the nautical decor, felt like we were in an elegant boat. The Etro toiletries were nice. Shower could have been better, more of a drizzle than a full blown power jet. Staff were very, very attentive and helpful. And the breakfast buffet was nice also with a good selection. Coffee was fantastic, wanted to take it home with me :)

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl214
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro is a charming hotel with an extremely welcoming staff. My friends and I were in tears when it was time to leave! We thouroughly enjoyed our stay and are planning our return to this delightful hotel in the wonderful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rotvi59
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel last august and everything was perfect, from the staff very kind with a lot of suggestions! Rooms are very clean with a wonderful view!they're spotless and very well refurnished.breakfast very good with a lot of choice. We will come back at soon as possible! We loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique,Simple, clean and very good location”
Reviews.Author: banana-republik
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here from Sept.3 to the 5th, it is very far down the waterbus schedule from the trains past San Marcos Square. Megayachts are docked in front of the nondescript hotel, just 'Hotel Bucintoro' out front. It is a small hotel with, nonexistent lobby. The staff were nice, ( about as nice as they can be in Italy, many of them are not cordial), they recommended a great restaurant Hostaria de Franz ( I'll write about that later). The rooms and hallways are decorated in cherry wood and brass fittings style after the interior of a classic yacht or ship. It is very unique. The breakfast was decent, although there is a problem with fruitflies. The rooms were very clean as well as the marble-floored bathroom The hotel although far from the train station by water taxi was quite close walking to san marco. I have no hotel to compare it to in venice, but I think this is a great bet. A little pricey but I think all hotels in venice are.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Bamaphan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 4th for 3nights and I definetly did not want to leave. A full service hotel in every sense of the word. Being a small hotel helps in this area because everyone their knows your name and room # as soon as you get settled in.We had room 102....kinda small but the views are awesome. Very nice bathroom...marble everywhere. I don't know why so many complaints about hard mattresses because we all slept very well...they are firm but not bad. The location is great also, close to all the attractions but less crowded than the main piazza area. The Arsenale area is super also because you get to see where all the locals live, very intersting in the afternoons when the kids are playing in this area. A lot of nice restaraunts in the area that are not quiet as high as the main tourist areas. Breakfast was good but cold menu, only complaint is that all hot dishes are not complimentary and you have to pay for eggs...bacon....omelettes. Overall I would definetly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location, great views, not much else”
Reviews.Author: ErinM7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Hotel Bucintoro for two weeks for our 15th anniversary trip, 9/1/11-9/13/11. We pre-paid for our room one year in advance. Upon arrival, everything seemed standard, although we were told that our prepayment did not include all taxes as our receipt had stated. A new tax had been instituted in August 2011 and we were now required to pay it. I understand new taxes, however, since we had pre-paid and had a receipt stating all was paid in full, in advance, integrity would dictate that they pay that tax instead of us. However, they did not. We booked a jr. suite corner room and upon arrival it was identical to the photos on the site so as far as room appearance, it was as expected. The room was small (expected), the bathroom has no counter space (disappointing), bath towels are hung IN the shower (wonderful for the second person taking a shower) but overall was adequate. The bed was very hard- somewhat standard for average European hotels. Having had back surgery in May 2011, I came prepared with medications, but even with the medications, it was only after we returned that my back felt good again. If you suffer back issues, I recommend finding another hotel with back friendly beds. Upon return to the room on our second day, we found our hair brushes and curling iron IN the bidet, left there by the housekeeping staff. Our personal items had also been re-arranged and gone through. re: the bidet: I do not care how clean a bidet is, it is NOT sterile enough to store items that one uses on their hair. We brought this problem to the hotel's attention, and although they "fixed" it, they obviously did not understand why we were upset that our hygiene products were in the bidet. I threw my hairbrush away and bought a new one at the beauty store down the street.. and stored it in my zipped suitcase from there on out. Not even an apology for this happening. re: our personal items: I don't care how messy a guest in a hotel wants to store their items, there is never any excuse for cleaning staff to touch anything, ever. It is an invasion of the little privacy one has when staying in a hotel. The previous experience also told us that although the hotel is advertised as having English-speaking staff, it is only to a point. As people who knew very little Italian, we should have gone to a more internationally-friendly hotel. The front desk staff was inconsistent. Sometimes very friendly, sometimes curt, sometimes overly sales-pitchy. When asked for a reference for a restaurant, in all of Venice, they only recommended one. When asked if there were others they recommended, they informed us the one they had told us was the only one they recommended. Very odd and a turn off as far as service goes. We got to know many locals while we were there and recommend doing the same. They gave us the best recommendations for everything, not the hotel. Wi-fi service is given out in 24 hour increments instead of the extent of your stay. It is also given per person, so if you and your spouse both have phones that need to connect to Wi-fi, you will need two IDs and passwords issued. If you have a third item such as an IPad and there is only two of you in the room, you are out of luck for the third item. We had to get a new code every 24 hours the entire two week stay. It was only the last two days that they finally issued it for 48 hours, so they can issue it for longer and we recommend asking for that up front. The Wi-fi is also sketchy.. on the 4th floor, we were barely in range. Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not. We did not find it adequately reliable in keeping in touch with our daughter back home. The views are beautiful. The location is fantastic.. quiet.. on the edge of Venice between the locals neighborhoods and the busy tourist hubs The mini-bar is limited on snacks. One airplane sized peanuts and one potato chips. We recommend hitting the local convenience stores if you want to do midnight snacking as not only is it limited, but even more expensive than your average mini-bar. There is no coffee in the rooms, but there is a hot water teapot and teas. Apparently, coffee is only available with the breakfasts downstairs. You can get breakfast brought to your room for an extra fee. It is limited to a continental style meal with options such as scrambled eggs. It is fine for the convenience of having breakfast "in bed" but don't expect anything special. Also, check what you receive. On differing days, we got one order of eggs when we ordered two, and another day we received two pepper shakers and no salt with our meal. Attention to detail is a little sad. On many occasions, we received no answer when calling reception. There was also no voice mail to leave a message. This is unacceptable in any hotel. The concierge should always be available. Use the vaparetto to go to Murano. The reception will try to sell you on the "free private taxi" but remember, if you take the vaparetto, you are in charge of where you go, how long you stay and what you see.. which is a much better way to see Murano. Funny how there is no private taxi provided anywhere else. Speaking of taxis, despite the website stating "transfer to/from airport", we were unable to find this service. Be aware of when your plane goes out... ours left at 6:50 am... the perfect time where you are too late to catch the night vaparetto and too early to catch the normal ones. $110 euro one-way to the airport (about $150 US). Too bad that private water taxi to Murano couldn't be used for the airport. I'm certain guests would be much more appreciative of a ride to the airport than to Murano. Upon leaving, the concierge apologized profusely for overcharging us for one night. He gave us a receipt detailing all charges, which resulted in us being owed 128.50 euro. He said he could not take care of it at the moment but would get a refund issued to us asap. Not an hour ago, we received an e-mail now stating that we owe them 232.50 euros for the mini bar items and our in-room breakfasts whereas before, because of the overcharge of 361 euros, they owed us. Them owing us 128.50 euro is correct. Accounting seems to be lacking at this hotel as well. Review your bill carefully. Having traveled extensively worldwide and a good deal of that being in European countries, I can not in good conscience give this hotel anything better than two stars. The view and location are all I can see it getting four stars for. The rest is just average at best. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “View”
Reviews.Author: LawsonsScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time,the view from our room was second to none.The guy at reception was very helpful with advice on water buses,what to see etc.The breakfast was excellent with a large choice on display.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Buccintoro, gem!”
Reviews.Author: ozk81
Reviews.Content: We travelled last year during our honeymoon, so this review is a bit late. The hotel is a beautiful boutique setup based about 5 minutes north of San Marco Square. That means its pretty close to the main attractions of the city, has a water taxi platform right in front of it and is also a bit removed from the crowds. The room is beautifully finished with wood, and the walls have fabric accents much like the inside of a luxury yacht. Washrooms are small but very cozy, decked in Italian marble top to bottom. Actually the theme of the hotel is ship-like which I thought was pretty charming. Breakfast in the morning is great and is more than adequate to fill you up to start the day. The staff are wonderful with great tips on where to eat and what to do. HOWEVER.... they will arrange a free taxi trip to the glass factories, but be prepared for some AGGRESSIVE selling while you're there. My suggestion, take a water taxi there and walk around independantly so that the factory does not try to recover the cost of its cab ride from you. We bought a beautiful piece white there, but not from the factory that arranged for the water taxi... they were damned overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Sam2008London
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much and will definitely return. As others have said, location and views are great and it is wonderfully quiet. We found the front desk staff very helpful and (unlike some reviewers) were very happy with the bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: babydr1
Reviews.Content: So, I stayed here with my family recently, and I come away with quite a mixed feeling about this property. We booked it based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor, and we were cautiously hopeful that we had made the right choice. I'll start with the good, then get to the not so good. The hotel is only a few years old, so everything is basically clean and new. The rooms have an interesting nautical theme, that you'll either love or not. (We enjoyed the theme). The location is great. It's not in or next to St. Mark's square, so it's more quiet and less hectic than the many hotels in the touristy heart of the city. But, it's about an 8 minute walk to all the action of St. Mark's, so it's easy to get there when you want to. There's a great gelato store right next to the hotel that we visited once or twice a day, and there are many restaurants on a street just over the bridge near the hotel. Our room rate also included breakfast, which was quite good, although basic, and sometimes crowded, but it was a great way to start the day. I would also add that housekeeping does a great job. The hotel and the rooms were spotless, and remained that way throughout our stay. Now for the not so good. We arrived in early September, when it was quite hot and humid in Venice. One of our three rooms was brutally hot. We notified the front desk, who tried rebooting the air conditioning in that room, but when we returned from our dinner that first night, the room in question was even hotter and more humid. We informed the front desk of the issue, but they said they were sold out (the hotel only has 20 rooms), and that nothing could be done until the morning, when a different room would be found. Needless to say, even with the windows open, it was nearly impossible to sleep in that room our first night there. The hotel did move us the next morning, but that was a bit late for us. To make matters worse, the attitude of the staff seemed to change quite a bit (for the worse) following the incident with our room that first night. The friendly and helpful front desk became noticeably less friendly and less helpful. I suppose we could have just imagined this, but I don't think so. I suspect they were not pleased with the "trouble" we caused by complaining about a stifling hot room that first night. After that night, the warm welcome we got when we first checked in was nowhere to be seen the following three nights. Also, there is no concierge at this small, boutique hotel, so the front desk staff (see above) are the only source for recommendations, and they were sorely lacking in useful or helpful advice from that point forward. I will say that once we got the new room, the air conditioning worked quite well from that point onward. I would have preferred that the hotel find us an alternative place to stay that first night, but that was not offered. Even worse, as we had 3 rooms for 4 nights, they should have offered to not charge us for that one room for the first night, but again, that did not happen. So, to summarize, this is a new hotel in a great location, with a good breakfast buffet. If you don't mind the chance of having air conditioning issues in the summer, and more importantly if you don't mind basically being on your own with respect to recommendations and other concierge types of services, then stay here and you'll be fine. And, to be honest, I would say the good outweighs the bad overall, but just be aware of the issues discussed above.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, though not luxury.”
Reviews.Author: IvanVL
Reviews.Content: Clean, well situated, small hotel at 500 m from San Marco. The nicest rooms, with wooden ceilings, are on the top floor (4th). Great view on the laguna from al rooms. The junior suites are more like bigger rooms. A nice big room of 25 sqm is not yet a suite. The beds were a bit too hard for our taste. Breakfast is good, but not very extensive. You pay extra for eggs and bacon and other things. We experienced that the location of your hotel in Venice is not so important. You can get everywhere in the city with the waterbus, so most imortant is that your hotel is not to far away from the waterbus stop. Hotels further from the city center are less expensive and still only 10 minutes from the center with the waterbus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: suepeeza
Reviews.Content: Bucintoro is about 6 bridges from the busy, tourist part of Venice. A charming walk is from the hotel in the opposite direction to the parklike side of St Angelo. The restaurants in Via Garibaldi ( recommended by the hotel) were great. Hotel staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Location, Disappointing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SteppenWolf11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bucintoro for four nights, and it was our second time in Venice. Overall, the looks of the hotel are amazing - we really liked the fact that all interiors are done in a classical, but more modern style (that is, no museum-like pieces of furniture reminiscent of the 19th century France). The bathroom laid with marble was also spectacular. The Junior Suite we had wasn't large, but wasn't small, either - the size was just about right for us. Similarly, the location was to die for - four views of the lagoon and the shore, along with San Marco square in the distance (see pictures). The staff was also very friendly and very attentive. Just as a note, you might hear some noises at night of moored ships hitting each other while floating on the waves - however, the sound insulation in the room is very good, and it didn't bother us at all. In our view, it's a tiny price to pay for the incredible view. However, the one big disappointment was the included breakfast. There were no eggs beyond plain, cold, hard-boiled ones on the counter. No sausages, no bacon, and you had to pay 6 euros for an omelet (8 if you want ham in it) which was frankly sub-par. The selection of deli meats was also not very tasty or inspiring. There was also some prepackaged yogurt available, and some cereals. The exceptions were the fruit salad and croissants - both very good, but that doesn't make a complete breakfast. Overall, the breakfast felt more suited to a 2.5 - 3 star hotel, but definitely not a four-star one. Likes: - Great interior design and cleanliness. - Incredible views. - Very attentive, friendly, and patient staff. Dislikes: - Subpar, disappointing breakfast with no scrambled eggs, sausages, or bacon. - The wifi signal was too weak in our room, so we had to go down to the lobby to use the free internet access which was included.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: margaretmonaghan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and in an ideal position. The views from our room were fantastic and the staff were all very pleasant. It was very close to Arsenale vaporetti stop and away from the bustle of the main tourist areas. Lots of excellent eating places in Via Garibaldi a very short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious location”
Reviews.Author: LiverFamily
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location 10 minutes walk from St Mark's with an awesome view of the lagoon and down to the square, with superyachts moored alongside. Away from the madding tourist crowd, close to Arsenale and a more authentic local area and also the gardens for the Biennial. Rooms were comfortable and spacious, service was exemplary with very helpful staff and front desk, breakfasts tasty. Only issue was that during hot afternoons the bathrooms did smell a bit - reflection of some of Venice's ancient drainage. Overall very good indeed would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: Shadzap
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great views of St. Mark's. Can't praise it enough. Rooms are comfortable, clean and afford amazing views. The breakfast was a pleasant treat. Staff was knowledgeable and accommodating. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wow factor hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel very close to St Marks Square. The room we had had the most fantastic view and was literally at waters edge. The facilities, rooms and service was the best. We would definately recommend this hotel and return if we ever go back. It is only a short walk to St Mark's Sqaure and local restuarants were excellent. Just go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjshaw21
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The photos sold it for me as I love all things nautical and as others have said, the hotel has a deliberate nautical feel. Woodwork, white linen and brass fittings everywhere reminded me of the old style sloops or ketches I've grown up on and sailed. Pros: really nice rooms, excellent view down the promenade towards the square, very pleasant and helpful staff, everything very clean, nice simple breakfast all well presented, firm but very comfortable beds, great large showerhead (20cm diameter) in the bathroom, nice fittings. I so wanted to give this hotel a rating of 5 but I can give it only a 4 on account of these things: Cons: the hotel is a little far away from the main area of San Marco- fine at the start of the day but a little frustrating at the end of a hot day (August). The way round that is to take the ferry and that is well worth it for getting around Venice and back to the hotel. So in the end that was not a "con". The 2 problems for us was the internet was very slow and kept dropping out. Secondly, the air-conditioning, although on all day and on the lowest setting, was still quite poor so I had trouble sleeping at night as our room was still very warm. Other than that a really great small hotel and would recommend this to many of our friends and anyone thinking of staying in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Giles101
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by name by a friendly yet professional desk clerk. When we entered our room, we were almost speechless! Not only was the room one of the most sophisticated and beautiful rooms we've ever enjoyed, but the view--from our corner room--was postcard perfect. The bathroom had exquisite marble from floor to ceiling. Every member of the staff had the same friendly and professional demeanor and appearance. The breakfasts (some served in-room) were excellent. The location is perfect with a view as good as, or better, than anywhere in Venice. We were out of the tourist mob scene, yet were in easy walking distance to St. Mark's. I can't imagine staying in any other hotel in beautiful Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Chris-and-Tamara
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at Hotel Bucintoro was pretty perfect. In a city that we love for being busy and hot and compact this hotel gave us space and peace and long vistas. The location is great. Views from the windows of our corner room (204) were across the lagoon on one side and the setting sun behind St Marks on another. Close enough to the action and the Vaporetto so that you can easily get involved. Far enough away so that you can retire and relax when you want. The staff were helpful and friendly, the room was comfortably proportioned and clean and the breakfast was convenient and varied. At the price it was a treat for us (i.e. more than we would typically spend) but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will go back”
Reviews.Author: Alexander B
Reviews.Content: First class service with a smile from all the staff at the Hotel, we had a spectacular view from our room facing towards Grand Canal and Dodges Palace etc. The room was lovely always very clean with nice amenities. Breakfast was first class well presented and again staff were very helpful and friendly. For us the Hotel was in an excellent location a short walk to the Major sights and with many local cafes and restaurants nearby (Via Gariballdi) favourite restaurant was Ristorante Giorgione. A couple from Broughty Ferry, Dundee, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Daph8
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of Tripadvisor. The location is great - away from the crowds but still in the thick of it! Our room was small but wonderfully styled, had a fabulous view, was very comfortable and had everything we needed including lovely robes and slippers. Breakfast was a little crowded but no real problem. The staff were great and the place was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not friendly greeting”
Reviews.Author: othello1111
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it looked clean, was nearby the heart of Venice. This is true. The rooms feel as if you are on board a ship, wood floors, fabulous views of the water. It took a day though for them to get rid of an awful sewer odor in our bathroom. Word of warning, if you smell the sewer, tell them right away. They have a process that takes about an hour, and the smell leaves. Never returned, all was fixed! Fantastic breakfast buffet, friendly waitresses. Some of the front desk clerks were just delightful, not all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenGould
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in. It is about 5 minutes walk from St Mark's Square, so easy walking distance, but far enough away to be peaceful in the evenings. The Hotel is beautifully furnished and the staff are very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Peace after a long day”
Reviews.Author: DaneNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro for three nights the third week of June. We are a family of 5 and our room was perfect. One room with a double bed and the second room with two singles. A small room connected the rooms and had a single bed with a window. The rooms were spotless and the bathrooms were all marble. We loved the location of this hotel !! You can walk to everything but are away from all of the chaos. Venice is beautiful but full of tourists and vendors everywhere on the canal. The Bucintoro is just over two bridges and feels miles away from it all. Our view was beautiful and if you walk out of the hotel and to the left there are some great restaurants to enjoy. Breakfast was a typical european style and very good. There is a landing for the water taxis right outside of the hotel so don't worry about wheeling your luggage over the bridges ! You will love your stay here !!

Reviews.Title: “we loved this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lainie32
Reviews.Content: Beautifully presented hotel. All rooms are named after a ship and all have views over the Laguna in Venice. The rooms are luxuriously finished in mahogany good air conditioning which is essential in Venice in summer!! Ensuite includes rain shower and marble finish staff very friendly and helpful breakfast excellent with all you need for a good start to the day 150 metres from St Marks square and 100 metres from nearest vaporetto stop could have stayed much longer Compare different sights for the best offers! We did and it was excellent value suites are available

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: MaxNewEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our first trip to Italy for our 5th wedding anniversary. We wanted relaxed, subtle luxury the whole way and Hotel Bucintoro definitely delivered. Venice was the first city on our 2 week visit and the Bucintoro was a wonderful start to our vacation. We chose it for its location, website/photographs, and reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites. We were not disappointed. Since we were there in high season we wanted something a little bit outside of the tourist throng. Bucintoro is on The Lagoon - not the Grande Canal. It is towards one end of the popular main promenade along the Lagoon, which leads directly to San Marco square. Its about a 15 minute walk. The views from the hotel were gorgeous and the breeze off of the lagoon was refreshing in the Summer heat. Our room was very spacious - we booked a junior suite. And it was ultra clean; even with cream colored fabric decor. The bedding was fresh and spotless. I slept very well -- the mattress was too firm for my husband but most Eurpoean hotel beds are. The bathroom was beautiful and luxe (only teeny inconvenience was not much counter or shelf space for toiletries). I have some travel germophobia about staying in hotels/beds I don't know. I was 100% comfortable at the Bucintoro. The breakfast room/bar off of the small lobby is also lovely; the breakfast buffet was delicious and fresh each day and the service was excellent. All of the hotel staff were gracious, welcoming and helpful. We stayed 4 nights at The Bucintoro and we did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Property”
Reviews.Author: Daddy-Unit
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, attentive staff, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great views!”
Reviews.Author: keepitupLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night pre cruise. Small hotel, in great location, just 10 min walk along lovely promenade to St Mark's square. Views of lagoon from all windows. Staff courteous, friendly and very helpful over a problem with our luggage. Room was small but perfectly adequate for 1 night. Plenty of choice for buffet breakfast and staff happy to provide toast on request! Via Garibaldi is nearby and a great place to wander and enjoy good food and drink! Also lovely meal at Da Paulo by Arsenale gate. Enjoyed secret itinerary tour of Doge's palace: you must book in advance (we used 'ticketitaly').

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, great service”
Reviews.Author: Adriana_Ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Bucintore in July 2010. Amazing place, great location and service. I would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cally87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as our first hotel in Europe and I must say it turned out to be the best. Everything from being able to arrive from the airport direct to the hotel door by boat, the welcome and the rooms were more than we expected. The rooms are a good size with beautiful green marble bathrooms and it really does give the impression of being on a cruise liner, which is quite surreal when a cruise liner passes by within touching distance of your bedroom window. The view from our room was gorgeous, straight onto the canal and the bridges to San Marco, the location is ideal with the ferries on your doorstep to visit not just Venice but the nearby islands. The breakfast each day was exceptional, a great variety of cold meats and many cheeses as well as the delicious pastries and tarts which you can smell each morning wafting up to your bedroom! It was by far and away the best breakfast of our trip. I would not hesitate in recommending the Bucintoro to any of my family or friends, yes the beds are firm but we had the best nights sleep after all our walking!

Reviews.Title: “Once more again...”
Reviews.Author: Milady-Amber
