Reviews.Content: Just spent a couple of days in this enchanting boutique hotel set in the quiet yet cozy Castello neighbourhood:Venice is always full of tourists especiallyclose to the main Piazza San Marco but few bridges away,not difficult at all to climb over even if you aren't fit or young,you find this little corner of paradise.Close to the worthseeing museum of Arsenale,turning left leaving the hotel itself you are in Via Garibaldi,a street full of charminf small restaurants and some comfy shops and a postal office(I suggest you to proceed 'til the end of the street itself to find the real Venice no guide will never show you),a little further there are two big natural parks where to rest away from the madness of the downtown...To reach it is easy as preview reviews have already explained and just a couple of steps will take you in a extra welcoming hotel.The staff is young,friendly and well trained...from the Ladies serving an excellent breakfast to the boys helping you with the luggage or any troubles you might have to the other Ladies making shine the whole hotel each day...to the Sirs at the reception.I've been lucky enough to find again Mr Steven at the reception,an excellent top man in his job...friendly,smiling-I simply adore the way he smiles 'cause he makes you feel at home-,trustful in each advices he gives you...and he always surprises me by the easyness he speaks different languages! What's more,other guests'children like him a lot 'cause he makes feel them as important as their parents and this is noteworthy to have an excellent holiday.If I were the owner,I 'd be delightful to have such a great staff in a perfect location.Simply THUMBS UP for Mr Stefano and everyone there at Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL - RECOMMENDED TO EVERYONE!”
Reviews.Author: KatieE2504
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are from Australia and we stayed in Venice for 2 nights. I booked this hotel because I saw the fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor. Everything that I read was true - the room was fabulous, we had a stunning view of the water and surrounding area and the breakfast was delicious. I can't say that I disliked anything at all. Stefano at reception was extremely friendly and always finding ways to assist us in order to make our stay a great one and he did!!! He offered to take us to and from Murano FREE of charge in a nice water taxi with no extra costs expected. As I read on Trip Advisor, the beds are not soft to the max but they are definitely bearable...my back wasn't sore at all - I had a great sleep! The maid cleaned our room daily and when we were out at night the maid would come in to close the outside blinds, which prevented loud noises. We were so impressed and thought that this hotel was the best one we chose in Europe for our entire 5 week holiday. The photos you see is exactly what you get and if you aren't happy I'm sure reception would do anything to make your stay amazing! The walk to the main square is only about 10 mins if you don't walk too slow ;) The hotel is in a quiet part of Venice, which is great. Its good to be away from the awful tourist crowds and in a quiet area. The water shuttle stops very close to the hotel. Definitely catch the water shuttle when coming from the train station because its the cheapest and you can get a nice welcoming view of Venezia.It takes about 45mins and only 6,50 Euros per person. ENJOY! Thanks Stefano, you are excellent at your job - we appreciated your smile and kind words :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Views"”
Reviews.Author: cm7872
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really proud of its high Trip Advisor rating as evidenced by the plague at the reception desk and the Trip Advisor emblem on the card key. I thought that was amusing. I thought the hotel was okay but I guess I was expecting more. The room we had was really small. It did not even have a desk or writing surface where I could put my notebook. The bathroom was so lacking in space I had to put my cosmetics in the bidet. I thought the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. I looked at one point and discovered it was on a platform to allow for under bed storage. In other words, the mattress did not rest on a box spring. My husband, strangely, loved the bed and he is always the first to complain about a hard mattress. Go figure. . The view from the room was incredible. It was just amazing and I would think most, if not all, rooms would have the same view given the layout of the hotel. But, we did not stay in our room admiring the view as we would in a resort. We mainly saw the view as we were dressing to go out in the morning. It is a short walk from St. Markâ€™s but you have to travel over a few very high bridges not those itsy biddy ones over the small canals in Venice. I go to the gym daily but was dreading the bridges towards the end of our stay. (We were there 7 days.) I hope my review does not sound too negative. I think the hotel would be PERFECT for someone staying just a few days but we stayed seven nights. And, the lack of space and bridges just got to us. Breakfast was really good. It was a lot of bread and meats. They had hardboiled eggs but cooked eggs were extra. Our room, and the hotel in general, was always spotless. And, the hotel staff was always very pleasant from everyone from the wait staff at breakfast to the desk person who gave us recommendations for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in an A1 position”
Reviews.Author: Lucy321
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by ship and had two nights there after our cruise. The hotel room was exactly as shown on their website and we loved the ship theme. Unbeknowns to us at the time of booking our room, the position of the hotel is first class. Venice was packed with tourists, especially around Piazza San Marco, and it was a leisurely stroll back to the hotel after each day of sight-seeing and back to some kind of sanity and very helpful staff. As we walked over each ponte on our way back to the hotel we had less people to contend with and each night we ate at a restaurant in the nearby street of via Garibaldi in the Castello area which seems to have few tourists. Also, if you turn left leaving the hotel there is a marvellous park about five minutes walk which is very pleasant after the crowds around Piazza San Marco. Also, when you look through your hotel window, how many hotels offer the close-up view of cruise ships going past so close you feel you could reach out and touch them. We loved our hotel experience here because it offered exactly what is on their website and it's in a great position and we'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views”
Reviews.Author: mywonderfuljourneys
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, our room was impeccable with smart modern decor and large windows with stunning views of the lagoon. The hotel position was excellent away from the busy St Mark yet a short walk away with many restaurants along the way. Friendly staff and good service ensured a comfortable and very enjoyable stay in Venice. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bucintoro was even better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: dallasmom1091
Reviews.Content: My husband & I highly recommend Hotel Bucintoro. It was small enough that we got to know the staff & they greeted us by name every time we entered the lobby. It's in the Arsenale section of Venice which is within walking distance of San Marco, but it's a quiet area with fewer day trippers. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal & the many yachts docked outside our windows. It was very clean & the concierge was knowledgeable & extremely helpful. The daily breakfast was wonderful. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: agulihar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Check in was quick. Initial room allocated was a bit small and had twin beds. The hotel offers free wifi but it was not working in our room for some reason. After complaining, we were told that there were no other rooms but eventually were given a much nicer room (321 I think) the next day. This room had a double bed and was bigger with wifi working fine. The staff at reception were helpful throughout. The view from both rooms was beautiful. Location: The hotel is 5 minutes walk from san marco which is great as it is not too noisy and not too far. It is however on the side of Venice away from the the main attractions. Since we were walking most of the time, we never really reached some of the attractions that are on the other side of the main canal. In hindsight, we should have taken a boat trip to see the whole of Venice. Please avoid the hotel's complementary trip to the Island of Murano where the glass factories are. We were taken to a factory where there was a 5 minute demonstration of glass making and this part was great to watch. Then we were asked to look around in their shop and exhibition area. My wife didn't like anything on offer and this rude woman who was tailing us all this time literally escorted us out when she realised we were not going to buy anything. Her behavior just spoiled our experience.

Reviews.Title: “delightful!”
Reviews.Author: dougleach
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Bucintoro and as lovely as ever. Despite being a small (Boutique!!) hotel, there is no lack of quality in the rooms or the staff. Very professional and just far enough from Piazza San Marco to be "close" but not noisy. There is always the bonus of super yachts moored,literally, outside your window to add to the view and make you decide what to do when you win Euromillions!! The only thing I would say is that the trip to Murano is slightly set up in so much as there is an undercurrent of presuure to buy and the prices are ludicrous compared to all the shops you see in Venice itself. I accept there are different calibre of glassmakers but personnaly did not enjoy the "upmarket haggling trader" style you are faced with. See the glassblowers in action but I think i would rather pay to see the display and not have my own "personal shopper" on my heels in the shop! A little surprised the Hotel is associated with the process. Of course you do not have to take their offer up, but the moral is "there's no such thing as a free lunch" That aside ypu should stay here!!!! Stefano was on duty a lot when we stayed and he is a delight; very professional and a top man.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in a Gorgeous City!”
Reviews.Author: psalmist3
Reviews.Content: We found this gem of a hotel by reading reviews here on Tripadvisor! We landed at Venice Airport and then exited the baggage claim to the information desk. I received excellent advice from a travel guidebook to analyze your trip and if in Venice for a few days, buy a 3 day pass with a bus transfer ticket. A one way ticket was about 11 euro, so if you buy the 3 day pass right away which allows unlimited hop on/ hop off trips it is only 36 euro. The bus ride is about a half hour to the vaporetto (water taxi) station. We exited the bus and went to the very far left dock which was Vaporetto #1. It was a crowded but beautiful ride to the Arsenale stop (past San Marco Square and the Doges Palace). Then it's a short walk over the bridge and to your right is the Hotel Bucintoro! Very accomodating at the front desk! We had a gorgeous triple room at the top of the hotel with an amazing view! Highlight of our day was the breakfast provided in the small dining area. Wonderful cappuccino, muesli, yogurt, rolls, meats, cheeses, hard-boiled eggs and juices. It is fun to get lost in Venice and explore all the little streets! Do go out the hotel and turn left and you will find some wonderful restaurants down the Via Garibaldi (?) It was super hot when we were there but the a/c worked well in the room and we were most comfortable! Love, love, LOVE this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bucintoro is Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Giann021
Reviews.Content: Everything went perfect during our holiday! Beautiful rooms, excelent service, delicious breakfast and magnificent views to the heart of venice! I really recomend this hotel, from a honeymooner couple to an entire family (like us), this is probably the best hotel in all of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We really loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: SimoniCy
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms with adequate space. The bathroom was very nice although the pressure of the water was rather low. The breakfast had a variety of choices The hotel was close to St Marcus square (7 min walk) but was far enough from the crowds (a lot of tourists). We will definetely come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: sued_08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location - close enough to the sights but far enough from the noise of the crowds. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Lovely breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Spuddles
Reviews.Content: The only way to arrive in Venice is by boat, and ours swept up to the bridge by the Arsenale and decanted us precisely outside this charming hotel. The location is difficult to beat - it is less than 10 minutes walk to St Mark's Square and you can see the Campanile if you get a corner room. The view is beautiful and the hotel is so near the water, one feels like it is itself a ship on the lagoon. Inside, the hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff friendly and obliging. To those who are discerning in these matters, it is obvious that the hotel is well-managed with attention to detail. The breakfast is excellent quality, very fresh, and the rooms extremely comfortable and well-appointed. The hotel is located in a quiet spot close to the restaurants of the Via Garibaldi which are slightly cheaper than the central area. We enjoyed our three night stay and would recommend it to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: peanutbutter70
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff, loved the location. Both our rooms had an amazing view of the water. The rooms are VERY clean, neat, high quality sheets and bedding. Great bathrooms. They are constantly cleaning the common rooms and once again, the staff are VERY nice, accomodating, really made our nights in Venice incredibly special. Would only come back and stay here for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: Causewaygiants
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Bucintoro for our Silver Wedding anniversary on the basis of the great reviews on the Trip Advisor web site and we were not disappointed. The location was exceptional with great views of Venice but just far enough away from the centre to avoid the masses in St Mark's Square. The staff were all very smart, friendly and helpful and were always keen to offer their assistance. The entire hotel was absolutely spotless and our first floor room was perfect with an outstanding view, excellent (and essential!) air conditioning and a beautiful marble lined bathroom. And we disagree with the comments regarding the over-hard beds - ours was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Venice”
Reviews.Author: katekmc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bucintoro was an unexpected surprise! The hotel itself looks like a yacht inside. Each of the rooms (we had two with our party) was beautiful, with gorgeous new bathrooms. But it was the view from our rooms that was the most breathtaking. We looked down the Grand Canal towards San Marco. It looked like a postcard. The location was perfect too - since it was close enough to walk to San Marco, but we were away from the crowds. The hotel staff were very friendly and graciously helped us arrange tours and transportation while we were there. The whole experience was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ademonaco
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff. Very nice rooms. Great set up for families. Wonderful views. Away from all the chaos, but close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil corner in overcrowded Venice”
Reviews.Author: go2andfro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located being a short walk away from the overwhelming crowds of tourists in Venice. Easily reached from the train station by the vaporetto, there is only one bridge to drag the suitcases over before reaching the hotel. The hotel is traditionally appointed with professional and helpful staff. Breakfast is excellent and the views are enchanting. As for Venice, perhaps it is because I am Australian and used to a relatively new country with a sparse population, I found it to be an overcrowded theme park in various and sometimes alarming stages of decay. We could not move in Piazza San Marco, there must have been 8000 people there. Four cruise ships were in that day. As for the Bridge of Sighs etc, we gave up because it was almost impossible to move through the crowds. We found quieter parts of Venice and enjoyed them very much. I would think twice about visiting Venice during busy times but if you do, stay at this hotel for some peaceful sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, service-beware of concierge recommendations”
Reviews.Author: frequenteurotravel
Reviews.Content: We are currently spending 6 nights in this hotel in Venice. The hotel is located right on the waterfront, with a wide promenade, beautiful views, and about a 10 minute walk to San Marco. The location is quiet, just on the edge of the touristic area. There is a nice basic bar/restaurant in the building next door and an ice cream parlor that is rated in our guidebook. 3-5 minutes away is a wide neighborhood street with several restaurants, local shops, grocery stores etc. A little further is the park. The accommodations are roomy, particularly for Europe, clean, comfortable, quiet, with excellent bathrooms. Wifi is free. HD TV. The breakfast is excellent. There is no large entrance hall, lounge, bar in the hotel itself. The staff is very helpful, just beware of the concierge recommendations. Unlike most 4 star hotels, the dinner recommendations were very poor. The free Murano trip is a scam. Read your guidebook before you buy anything. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, location, style”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaCorbeanu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate our 2 years wedding anniversary. The hotel was chosen on our travel agent's recommendation, with help from TA reviews. Few things about the hotel: -easy access either with a water taxi from the airport (this is what we chose - 100 eur / each way) or by public transport - Alilaguna; -very quick check in (we arrived with an early flight) - at 10 we were at the hotel, and in spite of that our room was ready! -very clean room (hotel in general); -rooms-normal size (not too tiny, not too big) - navy style decorated (as on the ship Bucintoro - hence the hotel's name). Minibar well stocked; -cleaning service - very good, beds well made, enough toiletry products (shampoo, shower gel, moisturizer etc.); -breakfast - satisfactory: 2 kinds of ham, 1 salami, 3 cheese, roll breads, 2 types of croissants, cereals and fresh fruit, fruit salad, yoghurt, coffee / tea / capuccino, 2 / 3 types of home made tarts, boiled eggs (for omellette you pay extra), milk, 3 types of juices, gems and all kinds of sweets (chocolate etc). -staff-very helpful and receptive; -internet point near the reception (one computer); -free umbrellas at the disposal of the guests; -fast check out service. Hotel surroundings: ice cream shop and bar (with various types of sandwiches, alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks) just steps near the hotel (on the left side as you walk out the hotel). Also there are lots of cafes and restaurants in the vecinity of the hotel (either on Garibaldi street - on the left - crossing the first bridge as you leave the hotel, either walking to St. Mark's square - on the right as you leave the hotel). Avoid restaurants and shops in the near vecinity of Rialto and St. Mark's (high prices - not justified). Recommended bars / restaurants: -Bacaro Jazz - in the Rialto area - not too pricy - very fun bar - lots of bras hanging from the ceiling ;) and very good quality music! -Perla Nera (just near the hotel, on via Garibaldi - on the left hand side) - I recommend the Cozze alla Venetiana, risotto with fish and the turbot fish! -Pizzeria da Roberto (for very tasty pizza). Basically all restaurants that we ate in are great, all types of dishes we ordered were perfect (try all the fish types and sea fruits: you won't regret it). Recommended places to visit: -we particularly enjoyed our trip to Burano (lovely island, very colourful, with impressive little streets and vividly coloured houses, great little family shops and taverns) - take the public transport - from Arsenale to Murano (which is not so great as Burano but worth spending an hour or so - Glass Museum + central square), and then the LN line to Burano; -climb the campanille of San Giorgio (6 EUR), rather than the busy one from St. Mark's - better views from here (as you can also see St. Mark's square), no standing for tens of minutes in line... -try to walk as much as you can on the wonderful streets of Venice, rather than using the public transport - it's quite slow and very crowded...plus you get to see so much more on foot than from the boat. Food and drinks: -as for drinks: prosecco (if you like sparkling wine), spritz con aperol (good drink during the day - refreshing not too strong), Soave and Greco di Tufo wines (price may vary for a bottle from 18 to 35 eur depending on the restaurant / bar); -food: as I am a great lover of sea food and fish I've tasted almost all sorts of fish - all are exceptionally prepared! Don't miss the gamberi alla griglia, cozze (alla venetiana or in garlic sauce), sardine saore (marinated sardines), fegatto alla veneziana (veal liver) con polenta, grilled sea food (everything is fresh and yummy), sepie alla griglia. For spaghetti: I have only tasted black ink pasta (it was delicious!!) and penne a quattro formaggi (also delicious!). Sweets: the famous tiramisu (of course ;)) and try the biscotti venetiani!!! Try to avoid the crowded spots as it takes away from the beauty of the city... Enjoy Venice! I know I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Bucinctoro was the perfect hotel for us in Venice”
Reviews.Author: OakJohn94602
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Bucintoro because: it is a 4-star hotel with amenities we appreciate in that class; and we knew it was on the Grand Canal (and about 1/2 mile south or east of St. Mark's Square). The location meant that, upon arrival, the water taxi could take us right to the hotel and we wouldn't have to lug or bags over any of the many bridges. It also meant that the neighborhood was quiet at night, since St. Mark's Square is about a 15-minute walk. The hotel is beautifully decorated in a naval theme (bucintoro is the name of the Doge's barge). Our fourth floor room had an unforgettable view of the Grand Canal past St. Mark's Square. We could easily see the Campanile, the Doge's Palace and the top of St. Mark's Basilica. The service at Hotel Bucintoro superb in every respect. The cafe serves a generous complimentary buffet of breakfast foods: coffees, juices, breads, meats, cheeses, eggs, cereal, and all the best condiments. The staff is very attentive: Giancarlo and Stefano are very knowledgeable and helped us retrieve lost luggage, buy tickets to a Vivaldi performance at San Vidal, and change the pick-up time for the water taxi, when the time of our flight home was changed by the airline. Bucintoro is a solid, well-run hotel; we recommend it heartily. Thank you, Giancarlo and Stefano!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1903
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following reviews on TA and could recommend this for anyone visiting Venice. You will not be disapointed. The location was excellent, we chose to take the Agililuna (water boat) from the airport (25 euro each return) and this stopped at the Arsenale stop 150 meters from the hotel so could not have been easier to find. The first impression we recieved was excellent, the staff very friendly and professional and very helpful. Our room was one of the smallest but still had the most fantastic view directly over the central canal. The room was very clean and stylish. Breakfast is from 7am to 10.30am and is brilliant and of the highest standards. The breakfast staff are as professional and kind as all of the other staff we met. Turn right out of the hotel and within 5 mins you are at St Marks square via numerous eating places. Avoid these places to eat as they are ordinary and a beer is around 8 euro. Eating and drinking in Venice is expensive but you can find lovely authentiic food by wandering away from the large squares. There are also lots of "sandwich" places where you can buy a wrap or pannini for around 3 - 4 euros and these are excellent. The local spritz of prosecco and a ginger mix with ice is to be recommended. Expect to pay around 25 euro for a bottle of pino but you can find this much cheaper say 15 euro by looking around. The best meal we had was at Taverna San Lio behind St Marks square this is modern traditional venician food and very reasonably priced, including wine at 15euros! Venice is fabulous but wear very comfortable shoes as we walked around 25 miles over 4 days. Its also worth while marking on a map when you find somewhere you want to return to as its often difficult to remember which bridge you have walked over!

Reviews.Title: “I like it a lot!”
Reviews.Author: 50NO
Reviews.Content: We had 4 wonderful days in Venice in May and stayed in this stylish small hotel. THE VIEW! I'll never get tired with the view looking across the lagoon and the Grand Canal, day or night! I also like it as it is just far away enough from San Macro, away from the tidal wave of tourists. It is a easy 10 minutes walk to the piazza and it is a particularly nice walk at night. It is easy to hop on the vaporetto @ Arsenale to reach all parts of Venice including the islands. I love the clever nautical design to compensate for the small room. The staff are professional and we enjoyed the simple breakfast. The free wifi works well and there is a free PC to use near the reception area. The TV in our room didn't work in the first 2 days because it was somehow unplugged. It didn't bother me. I didn't travel 24 hrs to watch some Italian TV or BBC News! I think it is a rather romantic place to stay when you are visiting this fab city.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Hard Beds Beware .....don't plan on sleeping well”
Reviews.Author: golffla
Reviews.Content: Good service, great breakfast and a clean hotel but ...... the beds were rock hard and almost impossible to sleep on. Ended up having to take the bed spread and folding it as a make-shift pad to be able to soften the bed a little. My wife and I had seen earlier comments about the beds being hard and thought, "how bad could they be"??? They were right and whatever your discription of hard is, double it and you will be close! We also had problems with hot water and water pressure. The hotel is about a mile from St. Marks Square. This could be a problem if you don't like to walk. There always is the option of the Water Taxi or the Water Bus System. Recommend taking the Water Taxi from the Airport. About 100 Euro but worth it for your first view of Venice. Venice is a great place to vacation and we'll go back again. Unfortunately, we'll choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service - Challenges during the Stay”
Reviews.Author: VeneziaGal
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel Bucintoro due to their high-rating on TripAdvisor. To be helpful - I'll right the Pros, then the Cons: Pros: *CLEAN!! Extremely clean - everything from the elevators to the guest room to the bathroom. *Friendly Staff - Everyone extremely nice and helpful. No issues with a language barrier, our Italian is not great - but the staff were almost all bilingual. *Breakfast - "Continental Breakfast" was amazing! Juices, fruits, yogurts, cereals, cappuccino, espresso, latte, etc., hard boiled eggs, pastries, breads. Hot items available for a small fee. Lady who was the breakfast employee was friendly and smiling all the time. Great experience! *Windows opened, view on to the canal and the square -- lovely! Cons: *Bed is as hard as a board. I like a firm bed...but -- this was crazy. We ended up folding the coverlet into thirds and my husband slept on that on top of the mattress. The maid kept apologizing when we asked for the coverlet -- she said she heard the "bed complaint" all the time. *Warm water -- Shower never went above "warm". Didn't matter what time of day, night, or duration of shower. *Water pressure -- very low. Tough to rinse soap off, wash hair. The rainfall showerhead was nice, but -- no water pressure. *Air Conditioner -- 3 fan settings, the "high" setting rattled to a point that you couldn't use it. Maintenance came up and said the solution was only to use "low" & "medium". *Desk agent offered the "hotel taxi" to take us to Murano. He went out of his way to say it was a hotel service & it was "his pleasure to offer". Only when we got to Murano did we realize this was a glass factory sponsored taxi and we had to take a tour -- big pressure to buy. If we didn't buy anything, we had to figure out our own way back. Wish the desk agent had been up front about this -- not a nice surprise to have. *The hotel describes the location as in the Center of Venice...not quite -- it's about a 1/4 mile from St. Mark's Square -- more on the outskirts of the City while still on the island. We're pretty fit -- so, no big deal for us -- but, now that we know the City, we'll stay closer to the "center". Overall - a good hotel. I think I've been concise as to what we liked and didn't like. Hopefully this helps someone else make a more informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Frgarcia
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with great views. It has been recently renewed and rooms have good size and great comfort. Service extremely friendly and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from room, but hotel had some issues...”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were too high due to TA's ranking, but I have to say that I do not regret it because the view is SO amazing it was worth it. The value was also nice and we enjoyed the location, off the beaten path but close enough to everything. In fact, we've liked the Arsenal neighbourhood(we even went to a great trattoria there, recommended in TA restaurant section) and the position of this hotel even made us take some different ways and, therefore, look at different angles of fabulous Venice. It is located about five bridges from San Marco, facing the bay and San Giorgio Maggiore. The room is on the small side, but the decor is charming and the bathroom is very nice. The shower, however, lacked water pressure. The hotel common areas are fine and the breakfast is good, but not great. The service lacks personal and that was an issue for us in one particular situation: in our first night we found out that our tv only showed french tv channels, so we called the reception and a few minutes later the same staff member that was in the reception minutes earlier came to our room and could not fix it. He said that it happened because previous french guests had deprogrammed the cable tv to watch public french tv(?!). Since we are able to watch tv in english, spanish and portuguese, but not in french, only In the next night we could watch some news! I would recommend the Bucintoro afterall, but I've found my stay at the Ruzzini Palace 2 years ago much better. They don't have that view, though....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with great views, friendly and helpful staff, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph3009
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen after a lot of research, and surpassed our expectations. The view from the double aspect room was stunning, the level of friendly service just spot on. Everything was well maintained and very clean. The perfect location for being near to all the important bits, but just a 5 minute walk away, allowing for a little escape from the hustle and bustle of Venice. If you are watching the pennies, this is as good value as you will find, and still feel special. Thank you to everyone at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good service, minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Aluisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in may. We had booked a junior suite and got room 404, which is not a real junior suite in our eyes. There's just one square room with bed, minibar, small desk, one chair and one armchair. But all in all: a wonderful stay! The pro's: Wonderful view over the lagoon and towards the skyline of Venice! Good location, off the tourist ways, but near enough for walking Excellent service - the staff organized wonderful flowers for our room, assisted us with booking a city tour and water taxi, and gave us excellent restaurant recommendations! Nice decoration of the room in a nautic style The con's: Rather small for a junior suite Too low water pressure inthe shower in the 4th floor Too much dust / dusting not done properly (dust particles seem to come from the diesel steam boats) Very small wardrobe

Reviews.Title: “Introducing Venice”
Reviews.Author: Dorridge42
Reviews.Content: A hotel offering extremely high standards throughout with very attractive rooms and superb views over the lagoon. Well sited within a few minutes of St Marks and close to a Vaparetto stop which served all parts of Venice. Staff were most helpful and always available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel ,great location”
Reviews.Author: LanfrancLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over Easter and found it lived up to its excellent reputation. The location is perfect as it is only a 10 minute walk alongside the lagoon to St Mark's but far enough away from the main bustle of Venice to give a peaceful nights sleep. Every room overlooks the lagoon and we had a great view from room 401. The rooms are on the small side but the bathrooms are huge and as other reviewers have mentioned, luxurious. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The staff are really helpful booking tickets for concerts, arranging complimentary trips to Murano (there is such a thing as a free launch!) ect. Venice is great and if you wander off the main tourist streets even eating out is not that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Hotel just outside main tourist drag”
Reviews.Author: pm263
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bucintoro over Easter and had the Junior suite, with Balcony on the roof (room 501) , with views across Venice and the Lagoon. The room is not large but well appointed with sunken bath off the main bedroom, well appointed bathroom and a small reception area with sofa, which my daughter slept in. We were in the minority as a family as mostly in was couples staying. The room and hotel were spotless, the staff were friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast more than satisfied our requirements. The hotel only did breakfast, but there were plenty of restaurants/pizzerias to try within less than 5 minutes walk. We particularly liked that whilst the hotel was within 10 minutes walk of St Mark's square, it was far enough away that you did not step out of the hotel into a deluge of people (as you do with some of the famous hotels near the square). In addition, it was 2 minutes walk to the Arsenale river bus stop which we used frequently when we wanted to see the sights around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DJ-PumpkinPie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro was a great hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to venice. The one and only downfall was the bed, it was like we were sleeping on a rock. I like hard matresses but this was just too hard. The service was impeccable, from the front desk to the ladies in the breakfast room. The location was a little away from the main part ( about 10/15 minute walk) but it was right on the water so you didn't notice the length of the walk. The buffet breakfast each morning was really nice. We can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RobertIsaac
Reviews.Content: Arsenale is a good place to stay and Bucintoro is the perfect hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday3645
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ended our Italy trip in Venice and were so glad we chose the Bucintoro. We had room #203 facing the water and loved looking our both mornings we were there. The hotel is a few blocks from San Marco Piazza -- a little ways from the busiest part of Venice, but still close and convenient. We felt very safe in the late evening walking back from where we ate. Our room was clean and comfortable, good closet space (2), and lovely bathroom! The staff was friendly and helpful; always glad to answer our questions, give directions and give recommendations if we asked. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great service and beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: Andi7777
Reviews.Content: This hotel has charming rooms and makes you feel like you are staying on a boat. Even the bathroom was very nice. Right beside the lagoon, the views were beautiful. It was also easily accessible by water taxi. The staff there were great and really treat you well. If we ever return to Venice, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: FLYINGDOC
Reviews.Content: Ok just brief points- staff here are friendly, location is brilliant, quiet and great views. Rooms are a tad small. We had a superb room. It had a roof top terrace ( sorry there's just one room - 501 , that has that ) but the views from our kids room ( 404) were fantastic too. Decor is nautical and very stylish. Breakfast was great , just what was required albeit continental. overall , its well worth the expense, small , friendly and just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: PamOxford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location and it is easy to access the public transport and to walk anywhere. It is quiet at night and the views over the lagoon are excellent. I was staying with a friend and we had a twin room. We were disappointed that the twin beds were only 2ft 6" wide and very close to each other and this should be stated I think.. The room is well appointed and there is a nice bathroom. Breakfast at the weekend was very good but the fruit was a little tired looking on monday morning. We had an problem with the water supply (which was due to be fixed) and the hotel staff were helpful in allowing us bottled water and on our last night upgrading us.

Reviews.Title: “An advice given with the heart”
Reviews.Author: Milady-Amber
Reviews.Content: Last January I was back in Venice and returned in this boutique hotel for a very short stay..from time to time I read its reviews here and I can't honestly understand why it is not up to at least number three..all the reviews describe the hotel I adore so much..excellent staff run by a clever Mr Steven(politeness and ability in making you feel at home is their must),a breathtaking position with an astonishing view from the windows,rooms furnished in a very cool way..what do you ask more to can live up to the nines your venetian stay? Don't really miss this chance,trust me..if you stay for a single nite or for more-lucky you!-,you will be always at home at Bucintoro coz to live it is like to live a dream. And you know,dreams are made of magic. So,book your dream now and give my regards to its folks. Trust me,trust me,trust me. Have a nice holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyAC
Reviews.Content: What a great location, staff, accommodations and breakfast. i would only change the fact that a couple argued on the waterfront outside late one evening but even that was somewhat enchanting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: ThreeGoodVacations
Reviews.Content: After consulting with TripAdvisor when planning our stay in Venice, we decided to book this hotel. We are so pleased that we did. This place is amazing. We had a classic room, 303, facing the lagoon with an amazing view of San Marco and the Doge's Palace. The room was small, as expected, but extremely well designed. The bathroom was also well laid out. The decor is nautical with the rooms done in dark wood paneling and the bathroom in green marble. The hotel was nice and quiet, we slept with the windows open and woke up to outside noise only on the foggy morning to ship's horns. The hotel staff was very friendly and pleasant. There was an ACTV strike the day before our departure, which made us a bit nervous for our return trip to the airport, they not only reassured us that the airport taxis would be running, but printed out the schedule for us. The hotel is easily accessible from the water taxi and a short walk across a bridge from the Arsenale stop. Breakfast is included and offered a nice variety of options, including a nice selection of fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: flopper53
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this lovely friendly hotel and found it to be excellent value for money. Great views from our window across the lagoon. Staff are very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a standard room, which was excellent decor cleanliness etc. Breakfasts was of a very high standard to cover all tastes. In a superb quiet location away from the maddening crowd,which is what you need after spending a day walking the streets of Venice, but still in easy reach of St Marks. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a top quality hotel. I am sure we will be back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: patriciaannesearle
Reviews.Content: Returned home at 1 a.m. last night after spending 5 days and 4 nights in Venice at the Bucintoro. Room 402 small but perfectly formed, and the WOW factor when the porter opened the shutters of our window - the view of the bridge, the Doge's Palace and the Campanale in St Marks Square, all just a stroll away. The Vap stop at Arsenale a few steps away to get anywhere we wanted on the Grand Canal and the other islands. Via Garibaldi just the next street with bars, cafe's and restaurants. We loved walking all over Venice getting lost and absorbing the atmosphere, from narrow calle's to lovely campo's to stop for a galeto, coffee or glass of prosecco and people watch - perfect. And the unexpected week of hot sunny weather topped our trip off nicely. Loved Venice but this was just a taster, there was so much more to see , so many museams, churches etc we didn't go into, knowing we could leave these till our next visit, as we will definately be coming back, and would happily book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jaybeeFaro
Reviews.Content: Waterfront Hotel. 10 mins from San Marco and Rialto. 2 mins from water buses. Best view in Venice from all rooms. Rooms in wood decorated as luxury ships cabin. Very clean. Good breakfast. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: m0hanb
Reviews.Content: We selected the Bucintoro based on a friend's recommendation and we did not regret it for a moment. From the time we exchanged our first pre-arrival emails to our actual arrival, and thereafter our week's stay ... we were made to feel welcome. The service was professional yet courteous ... and always accompanied by a smile. Great location - on the Riva degli Schiavoni, next to the Arsenale vaporetto stop. Our room, albeit on the smallish side, was beautifully fitted out and had great views. Aside from an excellent breakfast (served in the Bar), no other meals offered - but that did not pose a problem as there are plenty of places to eat nearby, especially on Via Garibaldi. Another big plus ... free internet ! Two minor niggles: would have loved to have had coffee/tea facilities, and at least one TV channel in English in the rooms. Despite this, would heartily recommend the Bucintoro to everyone. We look forward to our next stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel and had a fantastic time. Hotel is perfect. fantastic views and spotless. Breakfast is adequate but if you do want hot food then you do have to pay extra. Hotel is in a great location, 10mins stroll from main square......which is a welcoming escape due to Venice being so busy !!! 3 days was just enough as such an expensive place for everything.....we were paying 22 euros for 2 beers !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lorpt
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel with a good location-5 min walk to St Mark's Square, just a few feet away from valporetto stop and right on the waterfront, yet very quiet and safe at night. Breakfast was good and hotel staff extremely helpful and friendly. Gian at the front desk gave great recommendations for restaurants and sightseeing. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes the reviews are correct - brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: heidivodka
Reviews.Content: Is this the best hotel in Venice - I don't know it's the only one I have stayed at. However I doubt you could get a better value hotel. Would I stay again - without a doubt! Room lovely as is the bathroom. Him indoors said he could happily end his days at the Bucintoro and die happy (especially with the best seafood restaurant the Corte Sconte so nearby!!). Staff lovely, breakfast fine and yes beds firm but slept very very well on them and want my own!! OK no English speaking tv but how sad if you come to Venice to watch TV!! We came to eat and drink and enjoy the surroundings - and we did that!! The peace and quiet of the Bucintoro in Arsenale was lovely - as others have said - away from the madness of San Marco. Next time I will get the train from the airport to Venice (or better still a train from Paris) and get a water taxi from the station to the hotel - all the way down the grand canal - what a great start. If money is tight I will get the no. 1 waterbus to Arsenale for 6.50 euros. To all of you about to go to the Bucintoro and Venice - I envy you - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are spot on...good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Shazzarinski
Reviews.Content: Agree with all previous reviews...down to the firmness of the beds..and pillows..! Excellent location, helpful staff and cheesecake on the breakfast buffet...breakfast of champions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - We cannot fault anything at all with this Hotel...thank you.”
Reviews.Author: Williams6167
Reviews.Content: We booked Bucintoro on the strength of the reviews and had a fantastic four days in Venice. So easy to get to from the airport via water bus. All the hotel staff were fabulous and the hotel itself and the views simply amazing. Our advice does not relate to the hotel but just make sure you check the prices in the local bars as there is tremendous variety in the prices you will pay...anything from 7-15 euros for a glass of larger and a small wine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, good location, views for good price”
Reviews.Author: Tickie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Bucintoro for 3 nights in early January. A truly beautiful, small boutique hotel with amazing rooms and stunning marble bathrooms. We picked this hotel because it guaranteed a canal view room for a very good price. We stayed in a classic room which we thought was perfectly adequate for our stay. The beds were comfortable and the attention to detail of the fixtures and fittings made it an intimate, pleasurable and luxurious experience. The location of this hotel is perfect. A walkable distance to San Marco meant that we didn't need to buy the 3 day vaparetto pass but it's also very close to the Vaparetto stops when you are coming and leaving from either the train station or the airport. As the hotel is on the grand canal, it means that the hotel is very easy to find. When we were leaving, we managed to take a peak at the suite next to our room. The lay out of this room meant that you had a view of the canal from your bed and there was a separate area where you could drink wine whilst admiring the view. Worth the price if you have the extra cash! Things that could be improved: - The staff were abrupt and didn't look like they cared much about us but this may be typical of Venice and not particular to this hotel. - The room had a slight cigarette smell when we arrived. We kept the windows open when we went out for food and this helped but probably not a good idea if you have valuables in the room! - The quality of the breakfast food was good but we would have liked more variety and wished that the hot food wasn't so expensive to order but again, this may also be typical to Venice - There weren't many English TV channels I still think that it's a great hotel though and would definitely recommend it to my best friends!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here--perfect distance from San Marco, close to less-touristy areas”
Reviews.Author: Sirk98
Reviews.Content: Aside from having an awkward entrance/front desk setup and a slightly irritating shower setup, I have nothing but praise for Bucintoro and its staff The lobby may be modest, but the rooms are beautiful! I was at first a little concerned that my room would be noisy (second floor--called the first though, facing a piazza on the water), but that concern was unfounded (with the windows closed anyway--it was early Feb when we were there). The bed was extremely comfortable and the room as a whole was beautifully decorated. The bathroom was pristine. Breakfast was good, but we had a better one in Rome earlier in the trip. The view from the breakfast area was fantastic. Perhaps the best thing, IMHO, was its location. It was a 10 min walk to San Marco and we were definitely on what seemed to be the start of the less touristy (if there is such a thing in Venice *grin*) section to the east. It was a bit of a hike to Rialto, but I suppose you could take a vaporetto if you were particularly lazy that day :-) I would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisa85030
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 day break in the breathtaking Venice and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Bucintoro. It is a hidden gem away from the hustle, bustle and noise of Grand Canal but near to St Marks Square which is a must! The rooms were beautiful and the bathroom lovely. Only downside was the bed was really firm as I believe is the case in most hotels in Venice. The breakfast room is gorgeous and cosy with beautiful views over the lagoon. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious apricot croissants, cereal, meats, yoghurt, fruit, juice, coffee/tea and eggs - sets you up for the day - and you will need it as there are so many beautiful places to explore but take plenty of spending money - it is SO expensive - 9 euro for a beer...!!!! Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: douginoz
Reviews.Content: Great room with views across the lagoon. Staff very helpful with every request; nothing too much trouble. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice. Short walk to St. Mark's - which means you're away from all the crowds. Close to a 'Vaporetto' stop (water bus). Bit pricey maybe, but I suppose you get what you pay for - and we really had a wonderful stay at the Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller024
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel,had a junior suite very spacious and comfortable. Fantastic view from room. Location was perfect only a few minutes walk from St. Marks Square. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, beds are very firm”
Reviews.Author: nctravelbug
Reviews.Content: THe Hotel Bucintoro is a BEAUTIFUL hotel. The nautical theme is carried throughout. The location is superb. Right on the water. Away from touristy areas. Quiet. Easy walking distance to main attractions (2 bridges away). The service was great. Breakfast was delicious. Our only complaint was the bed was VERY firm. Fortunately we were in a suite that had a day bed that was softer. I had to sleep on it. Not very romantic... We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaltaOzzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we wish to have been able to stay longer. This hotel is one of the most perfect hotels I have ever stayed in. It is very easy to find, a short walk from the vaporetto stop, very very clean, romantic atmosphere, beautiful views, fantastic staff that are very attentive and helpful and all speak very good english, lovely and fresh breakfast in such a relaxing ambience, a cosy bar and a perfect room with a very spacious bathroom. If I return to venice, i will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights not enough”
Reviews.Author: Karendoll
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to the Bucintoro for his 40th birthday and we were not disappointed. Everything was perfect, the location, the views, the staff. We are planning to go back there when our son is old enough to appreciate Venice and when we do we will stay at the Bucintor again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, excellent service, clean and quite rooms, great views, exceptional breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: poohness
Reviews.Content: Rooms were cozy with very nice detail touches. Bathroom was modern and also paid attention to the details. Both rooms were exceptionally clean. The distance from St Mark's provided a nice stroll and quiet evenings

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: galynka
Reviews.Content: Staff was courteous and helpful from the moment we walked through the door. The room was a little bit narrower than anticipated but a beautifully furnished room nonetheless, views were breathtaking. I know it may sound silly but the bathroom was impressive!! Marble everywhere, heated towel rack and very spacious jacuzzi tub. Having a complimentary breakfast in the room was a nice perk too, it made us feel very pampered. We were offered also a free trip to Murano Island by the hotel. We worried that it may have been a scam as we read in many other reviews, but no one charged us for the tour or the ride to or from the island. So we were very pleased The breakfast spread was very abundant and fresh. I cant wait to come back to Venice and stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Down to Earth”
Reviews.Author: Accidental_Hedonist
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Venice before, I was a little apprehensive of the hotel. Would it be gaudy? Touristy? Overpriced? The Hotel Bucintoro is none of those. It's a smaller, very comfortable hotel, notable for being just far enough away from the Madness around San Marco as to not be affected by it, but close enough that it wasn't a major walk to get there. In a phrase, it's located brilliantly. But that's not what makes this hotel special. That honor belongs to the staff, who were friendly and helpful. They directed my friend and I to a variety of events that they thought appropriate, and suggested a few others. And when we said that we had to check out early in the morning, they made sure that we had a small breakfast to take with us for our travels. It's this sort of customer service that separates the great hotels from the good. As for the rooms? They were clean, cozy, and delightful. We had booked a larger room, which certainly helped, and the heated bathroom floors helped us re-acclimate on one of the cold rainy days that occurred while we were there. If I ever head back to Venice, I'm going to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect-we will come again!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty2010_12
Reviews.Content: Very nice atmosphere in the rooms and also in the breakfast room, great view, very friendly staff, everything was very clean.For some years we booked every year a different hotel for our stay in Venice, but now we found "our" hotel. We will come again.We never heard any noise in our room, absolutely quiet. Entering the hotel at any time of the day, we enjoyed the wonderful smell of homemade cakes :-)

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bobpowers
Reviews.Content: The rooms are exquisite, like those of a luxury ship from the old days. We loved it. The staff were delightful, we found a good price on-line, and we couldn't have been happier. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel, friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SusanJudd
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 days in Venice before taking a cruise. Our travel agent recommended hotels that were very high priced, so we decided to find one on our own. This hotel was reasonably priced (under $200) and gave us exactly what we were looking for. Close to St. Mark's Square, on the waterfront, but a few blocks away and quiet. Morning breakfast was lovely, and they had a complimentary computer room for guests. The staff never tired of our endless questions. Rooms were nice, with an enclosed shower. Go to their website for photos. (Beds were a bit too firm)

Reviews.Title: “A must return asap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: QueenieKC
Reviews.Content: All was absolutely perfect,/exceeding our expectations: location, food, sleep, decor, cleanliness, staff. No complaints. We are returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: natc082
Reviews.Content: superb hotel! everything perfect! great location just moments from Arsenale vaporetta stop that serves the number one route that goes all the way along the canal! less than 10 minute stroll to st marks sq yet quiet location overlooking the lagoon. views fab! our room was perfect! good size, great bathroom and nicely furnished! was great to return to warm cosy room after long day sightseeing. As with all the other reviews staff were very friendly and otherwise could not have been happier with the hotel and service. Would stay here gain without hesitation. Regarding Venice itself, you can walk around a lot of it without realising how far you have gone but it can get very tiring and the vaporetta was a welcomed way to rest the legs and nice way to see venice. in particular take the number one from one end to the other. I recommend that you purchase a ticket for 48 hours/ 72 hours etc as one journey very expensive when you are bound to use it frequently. food and drink very expensive everywhere...we learnt to try to find the small places off the beaten track a little rather than the tourist traps along the front! Marco Polo ristorante, Castello, s.lio 5571 was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: geogheganamg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day break in Venice and stayed at the Bucintoro Hotel. This hotel was located in an ideal position on the lagoon and the Arsenale vaperatto stop is about 100 metres from the hotel. Very attentive and helpful staff and small but lovely rooms with a view to die for. Breakfast was also very good with a good selection. The maratime museum is just beside the Hotel and well worth a visit. I hope to return to Venice and when and if I do I will stay at the Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Gem - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TonyRMa
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is situated right on the historic lagoon waterfront of Venice - our room had sweeping views that took in The Tower of St. Marks, the Salute Church AND St. Georges church across the lagoon. It was a short walk to all the major sights and vaporetto lines. The hotel itself is a little gem - perhaps too little for some tastes as it seemed more like a four star bed and breakfast than an hotel, The rooms recall cabins on a ship - gleaming mahogany floors and paneling and brass ship fixtures complete the illusion. The bathrooms were handsomly outfitted in marble and frosted.glass and impeccably clean - as was all of the hotel. The breakfast room recalled a ships dining room and, despite an unvarying buffet ,was a pleasure each morning of our stay. Complementary newspapers were posted at our door each morning - a thoughtful detail. All of the staff was unfailingly courteous and the concierges well informed and amiable. Definately a hotel worth staying at for someone who prefers a boutique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Hotel in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: KatieTraveller75
Reviews.Content: Not only was the location prime, the rooms clean, and the staff warm and welcoming, but the free upgrade to a deluxe suite was a generous and unexpected bonus. The hotel's nautical theme was well executed, from the lobby to the hallways and rooms. Views of San Marco Basin were extraordinary, especially at sunset. Squarely between San Marco Square and Via Garibaldi, the Hotel Bucintoro is a quick walk to the heart of Venice or the soul of it's less-touristy neighborhoods. The rooms and bath area were a bit tight, but the overall experience (including a generous breakfast spread) was still excellent. We will always recommend this hotel, and have every intention to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Take the "High Ratings" with Caution!”
Reviews.Author: BK-TrapAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We Booked online 3 months before trip and confirmation was received via email, to celebrate our 10th Wedding anniversary. We had booked for 2 nights. We had been to Rome and Florence, where our stay had been excellent at Casa Howard and was expecting this â€œhighly ratedâ€� hotel to be the same. Arrived on 4Nov, 2pm after taking 70Euro water-taxi to this â€œhighly rated!â€� hotel, only to be told that "there's a problem with our booking system" and "we will arrange another hotel for you tonight". We were transferred to Splendid Venice Starhotel nearer St Markâ€™s square, which in retrospect was much more comfortable and definitely had better service and amenities. Bucintoro claims itself to be of 4 star standard, and to mess up hotel booking (which was made more than 3 months in advance, in computerised form) without making an effort to inform the client beforehand is unacceptable. Other problems: 1)Wi-Fi is non-existent in our Junior Suite 3rd floor room due to non-availability of signal coverage. When the reception was informed of this, the answer was: â€œwell the signal looks OK here at the reception. By the way, you could use your own computer at our reading room next to the front deskâ€� I am guessing whoever asked him about the reception at the reception desk?? I am more interested in getting coverage in my room!! Nevertheless, I went down as suggested, but even when I was sitting next to the reception, the Wi-Fi was obviously not good as the connection kept breaking off in the middle of sending ONE simple email! 2) Claims that room is temperature controlled/air conditioned but it was not working. Too warm with the windows shut, but too chilly with them open 3) Wife lost a pair of sunglasses and a hairclip during the stay. Weather was bad (raining) on day 2 and she left her Chanel shades on the table, inside itâ€™s case. When we moved on to Milan, she realized that her shades were gone, from inside itâ€™s case! What can I say?? Sorry fellow trip advisor members, I DEFINITELY do not agree with your high ratings for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “my home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BostonJake
Reviews.Content: I am reluctant to write this glowing review for two reasons: it'll become so popular that I won't be able to get in on my next visit and thinking about my stay at Bucintoro makes me want to drop everything, kidnap my wife, and return to Venice. But the staff and management of the hotel deserve my praise. It is a wonderful warm boutique hotel in a great location. The staff is gracious and very helpful. Enjoying the excellent breakfast while at a sidewalk table overlooking the canal is a treat. I was traveling with a guy friend. He had a standard room which was small by U.S. standards but typical for Europe. I had the next room category up (Jr. suite?) which was a spacious corner room. We were both very happy with the rooms and both promised to return with our wives.

Reviews.Title: “helpful efficient staff, good location, breakfast very good.”
Reviews.Author: etire
Reviews.Content: very good experience in venice. Hotel was lovely. Staff very helpful giving directions via email prior to arrival very handy with slightly confusing boat network to navigate. Rooms were unique but found it slighty odd to have a bath in a classic room and just a shower in a junor suite. Lovely view over venice and cruise ships arriving and departing. woluld recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !”
Reviews.Author: henkespresso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice and not to big, with a good service with a smile. The location is very nice but when you open the window, you are in Venice, a night you better close the window. The breakfat buffet is complete and fresh, but the coffee could be better, when you look for a nice hotel for a good price, you found it ! Enjoy. Our room was s,mall but in a good condtion the bathroom was really nice, with green marble.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further, stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Astrobat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I had expected from reading other reveues on TA and from the hotel's own website. It is beautifully decorated with a nautical theme running throughout the hotel. There is nothing dated about this place, (unlike many other hotels in Venice), indeed on the inside it looks like it was built only yesterday, but it still has a traditional charm thanks to the beautiful wood panelling, brass fittings, plush soft furnishings and marble bathrooms. We really couldn't have expected more. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful and couldn't do more to make you feel welcome. All the rooms have fantastic views as far as I can see and we enjoyed a picture perfect view of the lagoon, San Giorgio, along the waterfront to St Marks, ... it was like a postcard! Breakfasts in the hotel were very nice - a lovely selection with baked goods, etc and the usual attentive staff and again a lovely setting inside or out on the waterfront. I would strongly suggest anyone should stay at this hotel if visiting Venice and I would definitely go back to this Hotel, no question. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel right on the water near important sites of Vience”
Reviews.Author: CraigBuoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with excellent staff. Wonderful stay and would highly recommend and will be staying here again in the future. The most amazing part of our stay was looking at the Amerigo Vespucci (tall ship) every day in front of our hotel. We got to go on board to look at this amazing ship. Truly a chance of a life time for someone loving nautical things. The ship is over 270' in length and is in wonderful condition. I got some great photos of this great ship. I thanked the hotel staff for having this ship located in front of the hotel. They obviously had nothing to do with it, but they were very happy it was there. Very good breakfast each morning in very nice setting. Hotel managers were very helpful in all aspects and had good food recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: jhager
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at the Hotel Bucintoro. The staff are all happy to help and the location on the Grand Canal steps away from the crowds of St. Marks Square is very good. The hotel is very clean, the breakfast filling and the price reasonable for a Grand Canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located and small”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelled
Reviews.Content: Away from the mad tourist bustle of St mark's Square; two minutes from Arsenale river bus stop; quiet with great views. We had a basic room, which was lovely but undeniably small. Downstairs the brekkie place was great, there was a small office type slot with a communal computer, but there was nowhere to lounge. The staff were unfailingly brilliant. Very rare indeed. All in all I'd recommend it heartily; unless you CAN afford a crumbling palace type hotel like the Danieli, its grand.

Reviews.Title: “The boutique and beautiful Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: Carolynm4
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and I still recall my relief on stepping from the vaporetto on the first occasion and seeing that I was within easy walking distance and with only one bridge to cross! This time it was even easier because ramps had been installed over the bridge for a marathon that was being held, so it was a doddle to get from the boat to the hotel. This place is so stylish and in such a superb location. Staff could not be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bucintoro is fabulous!”
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro far exceeded our expectations. The location on the water of the Lagoon was spectacular. It was a short distance away from the crowds, but near enough to a vaporettor stop (Arsenale) to travel easily in Venice. The room was very comfortable and cozy. The view from our hotel window of the lagoon and Campanile was fantastic. The breakfast was delicious and very filling. The hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating. Tip - In Venice there are many bridges that must be crossed - take carry-on size luggage to ease the trip over the bridges. Tip - Purchase Venice Connected Passes 2 weeks prior to your trip in order to obtain a good rate on Vaporetto travel , museum admission, and public restroom admission.

Reviews.Title: “A dream of a room on the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: xenonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for 4 nights. The front desk at checkin was helpful and efficient. The location is outstanding. Our room overlooked the canal and we could throw open the windows and soak in all the comings and goings. Bucintoro is close enough to San Marco ( less than 10 min walk) and close to local neighborhood areas away from main tourist drags. Lovely garden park 5 minutes from the hotel which was a great find after the hustle and bustle all day of central Venice and the buzz of tourists and vendors. They have a nice buffet spread (and the serve hot chocolate upon request with your breakfast if you like!) In the afternoon or evening when you come back you can sit outside, sip some wine and watch the remains of the day over the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel neat St Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: WildcatNZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the waterfront about 15 minutes walk from St Marks Square. The interior of the hotel is decorated like a ship and the room we had on the top floor had a porthole in the bedroom, very unique. The breakfast was excellent and you could have it inside or outside tright on the edge of the harbour and watch the crowds go by. It is located a little way from the xcentre and so it is not in a very crowded area as most of the hotels nearer St Marks were. Just around the corner are 4 or o5 restaurants all good at reasonable prices. It was the most expensive hotel e stayed in, in Italy however Venice is an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “the view was an unforgettable moment in time”
Reviews.Author: islandparidise
Reviews.Content: The room was a Conner room very nice, with a priceless view of the walk ways and the bay. We walked just a few minutes along the main water canal to San Marco Square. Great location, simple but healthy breakfast included. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a life time”
Reviews.Author: Nothingunreal
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the top floor and in the corner so we got the best views offered and they were fantastic. Really fantastic! The room was a little small, but very well appointed, and the theme is carried throughout the hotel. Breakfast was very nice and the service from the staff was spot on. The location is great too. We came in by train and followed the hotel's direction about water transport and all went as expected. The Hotel location is far enough away from the huge crowds that migrate to San Marco, but close enough that you are glad you aren't any closer. We were met with a smile and felt welcomed right away. There is free Wifi throughout most of Venice, but the hotel offers a Wifi service too. It didn't work for my iPad, but the laptop was fine. (probably a java thing or flash) Because this is a review, it is only right to point out a few small negatives, which would not change my mind about returning to the great hotel. The bathroom shower curtain smelled, light bulbs were missing, and either you had most of the lights with one switch or nothing, so dimmer lighting would have been a plus. Lastly, the service at the front desk wasn't able to complete a simple train reservation. But, please, we loved our stay here. We will definitely go back, if we go back to Venice. I truly question whether there is a better hotel offering the views of the city that this one does. We booked our room 6 months out and got a 10% discount. Although the room was expensive, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TimTHF
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view of the lagoon and St Mark's square. Small room but full of character and adequate for 2 night stay. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was generous. Good location, with easy access by water bus. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant !!! What more can you say !!!”
Reviews.Author: Smiths26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Venice for our 30th Wedding Anniversary and I booked the 'Hotel Bucintoro' as I wanted our stay to be something very special, we were not dissapointed!! It's location is ideal, just 10 Mins from San Marco along the lagoon front, but far enough away to leave all the crowds behind after a hectic day. Turn right from the Hotel for all the busy tourist trappings, turn left and you are right in the local community - Perfect !! The Hotel itself is spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. On booking I had requested a corner room on one of the top two floors, as previous 'Trip Advisors' had suggested this tin order to take full advantage of the views. To my amazement they had headed my request and even kept this a secret on checking-in just so that it wouldn't spoil the surprise for my wife - Very thoughtful !! In fact, every member of staff went out of their way to make our stay both enjoyable and memorable, they were ALL very pleasant and friendly, real Stars !!! We cannot wait to return to Venice, and especially to the 'Hotel Bucintoro'. Thank-you once again for making our stay with you so brilliant !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & Quiet Oasis in the Hustle & Bustle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: doddpathhead
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Bucintoro for a long weekend in Sept to celebrate our Silver Wedding anniversary. The hotel was absolutely excellent with the staff as friendly and as helpful as could be. We had a corner room so looked on the Lagoon at one side and over towards St Marks square on the other. The room and bathroom were both well appointed and whilst the bed was a bit firmer than normal we had no problem sleeping after a day walking round Venice. The location was ideal being in easy reach of St Marks Square but also slightly out of the main hustle & bustle. It was easy to get to from the airport using the Venice express bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma (3 Euros) and then line 1 on the waterbus to the Arsenale stop (6.5 Euros) which is just a few yards from the hotel. The breakfast was excellent and a delightful way to start the day. Everywhere in Venice is a photo opportunity and we particularly enjoyed walking round the Dorsodura area where we saw more of local life including a very happy wedding party getting pictures taken in a square. Yes Venice is expensive but what a marvelous weekend and I am sure we will be returning in the future. I would certainly hope to go bac to the Hotel Bucintoro if we did

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful service -- but rock-hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Amoire
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro was, in my opinion, a good place to stay for the start of our honeymoon. When overwhelmed in St. Mark's by tourists and cruise ship passengers, you can cross four bridges and admire Venice from afar while still experiencing the city's charm. We stayed on the fourth floor in a corner junior suite. The room was a good size with a very nice bathroom (marble with large shower/tub). The views were breathtaking, and it was extraordinary to watch enormous cruise ships pass by our window in the morning. Comfortable sleeping, on the other hand, left much to be desired. The beds were the hardest I had ever experienced. One other con was the fact that, on our check-out date, the elevator broke. I had sprained my ankle the night before, so it was unfortunate to hobble up and down for breakfast and bags without the luxury of the lift. On the plus side, the breakfast that I mentioned was a great spread with juices, meats, yogurts, fresh fruit, fruit salad, cereal, biscuits, etc. The morning wait staff was always pleasant and cheerful. One little antecdote: at around 7:00 a.m. each morning, I would wake up to the divine scents of freshly-baked pastries. It smelled like heaven. The rate was pretty expensive -- but it is Venice, afterall. That said, I would still recommend this hotel if it was within the budget. It is the perfect distance from the sometimes bothersome bustle of Venice, but easily accessible by Vaporetto and the Alilaguna (red line) from the airport (Arsenale stop).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, quiet, hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: deborahf26
Reviews.Content: Quiet and clean with an accommodating staff. We were in a room on the 4th floor facing The Grand Canal and it felt as though we were on a docked ship. Only complaint....the bed is extemely hard.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hassle and bustle but near enough to enjoy the splendours”
Reviews.Author: RiberacHermitcrab2
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful stay in a junior de luxe suite, a nice sitting area, well appointed bathroom and twin bed room. The beds were rather narrow and hard otherwise I would give another star for sleep quality. Efffcient room controlled a/c and external shutters plus heavy curtains kept the room cool and dark, wonderful not to be woken by the very bright late September sunshine. Breakfast outside on the wide promenade was a great way to start the day and watching the lagoon with all the boats and the ever changing scene a constant delight. The Castello district is a real part of Venice and yet very close to all the iconic sights and sites. We were very glad to be 2-3 bridges away from the crowds.Noticed some of the other hotels I had considered before booking the Bucintoro and glad we had chosen this one. One thing, the name Hotel Bucintoro is on both facades of the building, above the second floor level so do not undersstand an earlier comment about no signs, no signs in neon, true but the Hotel is marked clearly! The Arsenale vaporetto stop was on hand and a good service. One receptionist was less amiable than others but overall the staff were helpful and friendly.
