We made use of the tiny library of books and the free WIFI service. Would love to go again but expect this to be a once in alifetime visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: SamanthasDad
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Located three bridges from the St. Mark's crowds and immediately adjacent to a neighborhood (with family friendly restaurants and their more reasonable prices), the hotel boasts a great location at the end of the Grand Canal and beginning of the bay. Sitting outside at night with a glass of wine watching the cruise ships leave is a delight. Having never been to Venice, I was worried about logistics. Getting to the hotel via the public water taxi from the train station is easy. You really don't need to pay for the private water taxi. Just one bridge to carry your suitcase and you are there - a very short walk even after a long day of travel. Hotel itself is immacualately maintained by a great staff. The morning breakfast (sit outside like others have mentioned) is served with beautiful dishes and stemware. Upgrade to a junior suite and you will appreciate the extra room and extra windows! Thanks to Trip Advisor fans for helping us select this gem.

Reviews.Title: “LIVED UP TO THE REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: ajb72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Venice . Stayed in junior suite, room 204, which had a fantastic view of the sea and also along the street towards St Marks Square which is only about 5 minutes walk away. Very clean and comfortable, friendly staff throughout, substantial continental breakfast and although in a prominent position was perfect for an undisturbed nights sleep after a day on your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Great View”
Reviews.Author: Josepedro
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in this little gem in August this year and were both impressed by the view. It was later on the first day we were exposed to the impressive service offered from the main desk. We were advised where to eat to avoid getting ripped off, good ideas for sight seeing and an alternative gondola service. I wish there was a higher rating I could give as we were both so happy with all aspects of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in the Bucintoro was a very...”
Reviews.Author: cgdublin
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Bucintoro was a very enjoyable experience. The view from the room was delightful and the room was lovely if a little small. Staff very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was excellent. The hotel does not have a restaurant but this is not a problem as there are many fine restaurants locally. The location is ideal as you are only a couple of minutes from a water bus stop that will take you anywhere including the airport. St. Mark's Square is only a few minutes walk away. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accommodation with Phenomenal Views”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro for three nights in mid-August, on our first visit to Venice. The Bucintoro is relatively close to the Arsenale Vaporetto stop, though you must cross a bridge to access the hotel (which is difficult with luggage). The location is more tranquil than San Marco, though rather removed from the main sights. The hotelâ€™s dÃ©cor is very stylish, in a luxe, nautical theme, which was a nice variation from the overly rich and cluttered traditional Venetian style. First impressions of the property were mixed. It has a charming, if slightly Spartan faÃ§ade, with a less than grand entrance into the "lobby". The hotel's "lobby" is really only three feet of space between the entrance and the reception desk, and the bar is located within the breakfast room. Throughout our stay, we did not see a single doorman or porter, and we were not given assistance with our luggage upon arrival or on departure to the water taxi. The hotel's signage is also rather poor, as the only street-level sign is a little plaque adjacent to the doorway, with tiny lettering. This proved to be slightly annoying while having breakfast on the terrace, as people who were not guests wandered in asking to be seated, thinking it was a restaurant. When we arrived in our room we were very underwhelmed. Our first room, No. 403, was located on the fourth floor. Though the view was incredible and we could see all the way across the basin, and down the harbor front, the room was absolutely tiny, not helped by the unusually low ceilings and oppressive wood paneling. The bathroom, though beautifully finished, was equally miniscule and did not have a bathtub. When we reserved (directly through the hotel's website), we explicitly requested two twin beds. The first room had only one bed, and as it was queen-sized, it could not be divided into two twins. When we notified reception of this issue, they did not apologize, said that we did not ask for twin beds in the first place, and told us that there was no availability that night to change rooms. We moved rooms the next morning to a much more satisfactory room on the second floor. Though it was even smaller (eight by ten feet at most), it had a higher, barrel-vaulted ceiling with very large windows opening onto the identical view as our previous room. Our second room, No. 203 had two beds and a bathtub. Though the second room was nicer, there were a few minor issues with both rooms. There were no drinking glasses in either room, just plastic cups; the beds and pillows were rock-hard, and very uncomfortable; and both rooms had hardly any furniture. Our second room had only two beds, two end tables, a side chair, and a tiny corner "table". On the plus side, the views from all points in the hotel were amazing, and having breakfast on the terrace was nice first thing in the morning, Breakfast itself was also very good and traditional. Again, the overall aesthetic of the property was unique, though a clever way to camouflage small rooms. Service was mostly good, though the concierge was not top-notch. I would not rely on his advice concerning restaurants, as he sent us to a very touristy place right on the lagoon with average food. I booked the Hotel Bucintoro mostly due to the extremely positive reviews on this website, and its expansive view of St. Mark's Basin, and it lived up to only part of its pretext. Upon my return home, I discovered that the hotel emailed, blatantly requesting I write a positive review on TripAdvisor. I found this insulting and off-putting. To ask for a review is acceptable, but to practically demand a positive review is not. I now know how they have obtained their 98% traveler â€œsatisfactionâ€� rating. Our stay at the Bucintoro could have been a thoroughly positive and memorable experience, though all the minor inconveniences and issues have overridden the positives. I am unsure as to whether I would return to the Hotel Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “It's wonderful to relax on the terrace and still see Venice go by”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraVanMeir
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well appointed, with great bathrooms, and very well maintained and cleaned. The service is professional and friendly, we felt most welcome and everyone did their very best to make our stay easy - we travelled with a four month old baby, and really appreciated all the extra help. The views from the room, and the terrace downstairs, are superb. We found the location great: space to walk the stroller, not far from major sights, vaporetto stop next door, and a good mix of residents and tourists to people watch. Definitely a find.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience at Hotel Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: SalinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Bucintoro. The staff were very helpful about vaporetti schedules and other sight seeing questions and made wonderful restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. The property itself is lovely, and the breakfast offered something for everyone. The location is excellent, in the Castello neighborhood, which is quiet and less touristy than the adjacent San Marco neighborhood, but it is just a short walk to the major sights like Doge's Palace, etc. It is very easy to get to from the airport or the train station as it is just a very short distance from the Arsenale vaparetto stop. I would gladly return, and spend more time exploring the Castello neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stayed !”
Reviews.Author: christian1266
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Buctintoro for along weekend in a benchmark room. This is a magnificently established hotel with glorious views.The room was spotlessly clean well adorned with air condition. The assortment for the buffet morning meal was good but Could furthermore be supplemented to from a sensible cost menu. The staff were well informed and exceedingly helpful. There is a pleasant seating locality out-of-doors the hotel were we relished some late evening cocktails. Our air travel dwelling was rather late but we were permitted to ascertain out subsequent than common our sacks were retained for the day at the hotel. I would have no hesitation in suggesting this hotel - although, rooms are advocated with balconies but in detail this really means embankment windows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: JWebber99
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in HB for 3 nights to see the sights of Venice. The small hotel is located right on the promonade overlooking the lagoon - all rooms have a lagoon view. The rooms looked new and were very clean - the bathroom was excellent. We had breakfast included and the breakfast food and staff were great. As part of a 3 week tour of Europe this hotel was the best of the 10 we stayed in, and have recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Arash-GTR
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, Good small but cozy rooms, amazing views of the sea . All in all a great hotel in the prime location. price was a bit high but the location and views of the room made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for exploring Venice, attractive clean rooms and great service.”
Reviews.Author: KKR21
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect, great views from the window. All the main sights in easy walking distance but it was just far enough away from them that you could escape the crowds when you wanted to. Lido only a few stops away on the waterbus. The rooms were very attractive, comfortable and very clean, a little on the small side for 2 women with very large suitcases but not meant to be a grumble. It was nice to have tables and chairs outside - pre-dinner drinks in the late afternoon sunshine watching the world go by on what felt like our own private terrace was great. Service was excellent, nothing too much trouble - we arrived early so went for some lunch and came back to find cases in the room. Late flight home but no problem to leave luggage after checking out, and were served complimentary coffee before we set off. Very friendly, helpful and personable staff. What would have made it better? Tea making facilities in the room, but maybe we could have had them if we'd have asked? Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect little hotel for a romantic holiday in Venice”
Reviews.Author: diverz
Reviews.Content: We spent an four nights in this amazing little hotel and cant wait to go back again. Everything was perfect, from the friendly staff, to the small but gorgeous guest rooms, scrumptious buffet breakfasts and breathtaking views of Venice and the lagoon. It is the perfect place for a romantic get away. We chose this hotel based on the excellent Trip Advisor reviews and found it to be even better than what was described!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: jkmashny
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bucintoro was a find on the island of Venice. Right on the water the view was beautiful. On one of the main streets, the hotel is placed a little further down from all of the activity. Right outside your door you will find stores, restaurants, gelato, etc. 15 min. stroll to St. Mark's square. You can walk anywhere from this hotel, no need to grab a water taxi. The hotel did offer a complimentary taxi to Morano, but it takes you to one glass blowing business and you are escorted all the way thru the tour and store. After you finish...you are on your own. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Great for family and quiet. We got two rooms for a family of 5 that was connected by a galley bedroom, where our youngest slept. Super clean and updated. Similar to rooms you would find at the Hyatt in the States. Nice complimentary bfast buffet and the cappuccino...delicious.Word Count: 120

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: kbrigs
Reviews.Content: Absolutly spotless beautiful rooms with detailed woodwork that had a feel of living in the cabin of a yacht or sailboat. The service was impeccable with a staff that was willing to help at every turn. Location at the mouth of the grand canal was not in the center of all the action but within walking distance to it all, just right. Great views from our room wonderful sunsets. Private breakfast and bar for hotel guests only.

Reviews.Title: “Top place for romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: Michal_Prague_10
Reviews.Content: Bucintoro is a cosy boutique hotel in the neighboroughood of the Venice central location, Piazza di San Marco, with a view of the lagoon and the San Marco's towers. The rooms are not huge, but very clean and comfortable, with a warm exclusive yacht cabin wooden design. The service is offered in a friendly manner accompanied with a natural smile, always helpful, trying to make your life easier even by small details. Breakfast - ideally served outside on the embankment - is rich and tasty. Definitely a great place to spend time together with your partner, ideally without kids :-).

Reviews.Title: “exquisite hotel close enough to everything, but far enough away for a retreat”
Reviews.Author: MUFC9295
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel's excellent rooms, superior and helpful service and friendly staff. Our only regret is to only have stayed two nights in Venice at Bucintoro. Very close to the Vapporetto Arsenale stop and a short walk to San Marco along the water. Less touristy restaurants and cafes plentiful just around the corner on Via Garibaldi (Nuova Perla). Complimentary water taxi from the hotel to Murano (and returning to San Marco) for a tour of the Murano glass factory. Beware: The guide will quickly turn you over to a pleasant, informative salesperson who will gladly show you expensive pieces offered at 50% the sticker price. Yes, we bought a beautiful vase. You might take your own tour of Murano (island) by #42 Vaporretto. We should have walked around more. I digress. The hotel wil be our first choice when we inevitably return. The complimentary breakfast is not to be missed. Complimentary wi-fi is also a huge plus as we brought our laptop. Grab a bottle of vino and sit outside the hotel and take in the sights from the front door. We did not do the suites, but might opt for these next time around. Our room was small, but perfectly adequate and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10th Wedding Anniversary Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Andrew40
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Room 204 - junior suite with views of lagoon and St Mark's. Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean. Good breakfast choices. Only downside was bed - although double room it was two singles together with a ridge down the middle and a VERY hard mattress (Bucintoro - when buying new mattresses, please buy medium ones rather than extra firm). Can catch vaperetto from airport (Arsenale stop) up to 7.45pm, after that it's the Sant Zaccharia stop - this will be 10 minute walk up and down 4 or 5 bridges - not easy with cases.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: JazzgirlWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We agree with the following reviews that we loved this hotel! We were in two connecting rooms on the 4th floor - the kids had two twins and we the queen with a little "salon" area in between the rooms with a chaise lounge and table near the window. The kid's bathroom had a huge tub with rain shower over it - ours was a somewhat tiny shower but as all others hae said, the bathrooms are luxe brick colored marble. The rooms are a small by American standards, but are beautifully outfitted with fabric wallpaper, loads of woodwork, etc. You are right on the Arsenale stop for the vaparetto boats, so you can easily get to the entire grand canal from there. It you want to walk, you are so close to San Marco square - you can see it out your windows! Don't forget to check out the Castellano neighborhood itself - if you head in the opposite direction from San Marco square, you will find a bustling, wide street with many businesses and restaurants as well as a beautiful park. Stay here with no worries!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice.”
Reviews.Author: medialawdoc
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Venice with my mom and we stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro for four nights. From the moment we arrived, we knew we had made a great selection. The hotel is very clean, the rooms nicely furnished, the location wonderful for touring, and the staff could not have been nicer. The concierge Gianmaria let us check in early - around 10:30 am. This was a great relief after an overnight flight. Gianmaria was friendly and helpful. We were then shown to our room by another friendly employee. Although we were familiar with the system of inserting a card into a slot to turn on the room's power, I thought it was considerate that he showed us how this worked and gave us a tour of all the bathroom facilities. He also delivered our bags promptly (the lift is a bit small, but adequate). We were pleasantly surprised by the room. Other reviewers warned that the rooms were small, so we were prepared for something very tiny. However, we found it to be adequately sized with two closet areas, with drawers for storage. We had two twin beds and two nightstands and a writing desk. There was a T.V. mounted to the wall. The bathroom was spacious with a shower/tub combo. It was very clean with nice marble flooring. The only negative comment is that the beds were VERY firm. Depending on your preference, you might like it, but it was not comfortable to me. The best thing about our room was the large window that opened to reveal breathtaking views of Piazza San Marco and the Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore. It was so nice to sit with the window open. We often turned off the air conditioning and enjoyed the breeze. However, when we did want the air conditioning it worked and cooled the room very quickly. The hotel is located in the Castello area of Venice, but is 10 - 15 minute walk away from St. Mark's Square. There is also a vaporetto stop just three small bridges away that services Piazzale Roma, Ferrovia, and all stops on the Grand Canal. This made all of our sightseeing outings very convenient. There is a closer one only one bridge away (Arsenale) when you come from the airport or train station and have luggage. Other reviewers have mentioned obstructed views due to a boat docked near the hotel. There was a yacht docked outside the hotel during our stay. Our view (room 202) was not impacted by this, but I did hear some guests complain. This seems to be an ongoing issue, so you may want to talk with the hotel staff when booking your room to ensure an unobstructed view. The breakfast buffet was very nice. The staff in the small bar was attentive and served a variety of espresso beverages, hot chocolate, and tea included in the breakfast (we had this as part of our room cost). The coffee was some of the best I have ever had. A special note about Gianmaria. I only saw him at the desk on our first day when we arrived and then once more late at night. He was very helpful both times, but really went out of his way to help me when a phone card I had purchased was not working. He tried dialing the number for me and even tried the Italian-language number several times. In the end, I wound up calling the States directly from the room. It turned out to be less expensive than the phone card! Thank you for all your help, Gianmaria! I cannot say enough about what a wonderful stay we had at Hotel Bucintoro. If I ever return to Venice, and I hope I will one day, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Saint
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Bucintoro for 2 nights at the tail end of a 12 day Italian vacation and wished we stayed longer! The hotel is away from the maddening crowds of St. Mark's square on the corner of a small canal and lagoon. We were in Room #406 which was the first room, top floor next to the lift. I was concerned about the noise since it also had a connecting door to the next room. But it was very soundproof and we heard absolutely no noise except for the water noise and ships passing (the hotel was at maximum capacity). The room had two windows that opened (something rare in hotels these days!) to the lagoon/large canal. Fabulous. Although small, our room was immaculate and the bathroom to die for. The bathroom is all marble...from the wall to the ceiling to the floor! The only thing that would have made it more perfect would be to provide robes to the guests. We did get slippers! The staff was very pleasant and very helpful. We arrived Sunday expecting to visit St. Mark's square and it was suggested that we enjoy a trip to Murano instead as it was hot and crowded in the square. Our conceirage was so right! He arrived for a private water taxi at no charge and a tour of a glass factory. Fabulous. When we asked about gondola rides, he suggested the evening gondola seranade ride which was very "Italian" and absolute perfect at the end of a hot day. Don't think twice about staying here...helpful and kind staff, perfect location, quiet and an imacculate room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful nautically-themed boutique hotel on edge of tourist area with spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: edpsychprof
Reviews.Content: This is the epitome of a hidden gem. The entire hotel was renovated from one where guests shared communal bathrooms to a top-quality hotel with beautifully-appointed rooms with modern bathrooms. I love the entire nautical theme, from the hallway lights that look like ship portholes to the restaurant that looks like a dining room you would find on a yacht. The staff is attentive and friendly. I also enjoyed my morning breakfast on the outdoor patio ideally situated on the canal where I could watch the city come to life before my eyes while sipping a cappuccino. One of the best features of the hotel is just a short distance (two bridges) from start of the busy tourist area where boatload of tourists arrive each morning and head west to St. Mark's square. I recommend room 404, a junior suite located on the top floor of building. By Venice standards, it is spacious with beautiful high-quality furnishing and a raised ceiling with exposed beams. The window coverings are tasteful and the wood panelling is beautiful. The bathroom is modest in size but it is well appointed. The best feature, however, are the four windows, two on the south side overlooking the laguna and two with spectacular views of St. Mark's and the entire waterfront along this side of Venice. Because of its location, you can see miles of the canal and literally hundreds of the buildings along the canal. I spent numerous hours just watching the city from a comfortable chair and ottoman in my room. I also slept several night with the windows open with a nice cross breeze but it can be a bit noisy due to the the wakes of passing ships causing boats docked outside to run against each other. But the sound of the lapping water was wonderful and since the hotel is away from the main tourist area, I never heard any rowdy late-night revelers. My only criticism is the bed including the mattress, bedding, and pillows. The bed is consists of two single beds pushed together so there is a crease down the middle. Also, the bed and two pillows were too firm for my standards. To be fair, I'm used to a pillow-top mattress and down pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RJV2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro was the perfect location for our stay in Venice! The area was quiet with great views and within reasonable walking distance to everything! The hotel was spacious and luxurious. The staff was very friendly and accommodating while also providing great recommendations on activities and restaurants. This hotel experience added to the charm of Venice making our relaxing weekend here one of my most favorite parts of our two week trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DDunning
Reviews.Content: Hotel deserves the high rating that it gets. Rooms were clean and luxurious, but not large. Had a very nice view overlooking the lagoon. As others have said, breakfast was very good and it was nice to sit outside in the morning with our coffee. It was far enough away from the hustle and noise to be 'just right'. The staff was both helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Venice Visit”
Reviews.Author: TXBud65
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-week visit to Italy and I must say that Venice and our stay at the Hotel Bucintoro was one of the highlights of our trip. We found this hotel on TripAdvisor and as with other tips we've used from them, they were right on target! This was a wonderful little place. We were prepared to be disappointed with Venice because of it's reputation for being so pricey and "touristy". Because of this hotel's location, those ideas were quickly dispelled. Located on the beautiful lagoon rather than the noisy, over-priced, and crowded Grand Canal, the Bucintoro offered the same charm and beauty of being on the water without the price, noise and crush of tourists. It's location right near a vaparetti stop made getting to and from the train station with our luggage a snap. We had bought a 72-hour vaparetti pass over the internet before we left home so we used it to go to(# 42) and from(#41) the train station and then took Vaparetti #1 all around to sight-see and experience the other parts of Venice and surrounding areas to our heart's content. It was great! We downloaded Rick Steve's free audio tours onto our i-Pods and "toured" the Grand Canal and other sights with him. Again, great! Our room at Hotel Bucintoro was lovely. Be sure and ask for a corner room. Ours was room #404 on the corner. It had four windows! Two looked out to St. Mark's and main Venice and two out to the lagoon. One morning we watched from our room as 3 cruise ships slipped silently past our windows. The rooms all are decorated in a nautical theme--very classy wood paneling. They are large and comfortable with extra seating. The breakfast was very good and the staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was served in a cozy breakfast room or on a ground-floor terrace in front of the hotel looking out over the lagoon. For dinner we asked where the locals like to go and we were directed around the corner from the hotel to Via Garibaldi--a wide thoroughfare where we stepped into the real Venice with authentic Italian food and street life. With a sprinkling of neighborhood tratorias and hosterias, it was hard to choose from those suggested by hotel staff. It's best to have hotel staff make reservations as these are popular with locals. Our least favorite was Nuevo Galeone and most favorite was Hostaria All'Ombra. You'll find fresh local seafood and pastas prepared by Italians in creative and delicious ways. Be sure and walk this street during the early morning for a totally different prospective. You'll know you're in Italy! We were prepared for Venice to be really expensive but we found this hotel and this area reasonable and yet classy and charming. It certainly deserves it's four-star hotel rating and excellent rating from TripAdvisor. Thank you Hotel Bucintoro and TripAdvisor! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in perfect Venice location”
Reviews.Author: Gazza101
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to choose this hotel for our honeymoon and it turned out to be the perfect choice. After researching many hotels we decided on this one as its a small quiet one which is just far enough away from the crowds but within a 6 min walk of St Marks. The hotel is 4 star and it doesnt dissapoint, the service by all the staff was perfect they all spoke great English and couldnt do enough for you. The rooms were amazing all finished in a navel theme and looked like something you would find on a luxury yacht, full of wood and marble very very nice. The location was perfect it was very easy to get to by boat from the airport, and being only half a mile from the crowded tourist area meant it stayed quiet outside all the time. We really enjoyed our stay here and i wouldnt hesitate to book again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the gigantic floating gin palace.”
Reviews.Author: mcfrog55
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly deserves its 4-star rating. Although the room we stayed in was rather small, it had everything we needed. The bathroom was beautiful and spotlessly clean. All the staff we came across were friendly and helpful, and most seemed to speak excellent English. Breakfast was fine, if somewhat unimaginative. 'Extras' were rather expensive, so we stuck to the basics. The one BIG drawback with this hotel was the massive luxury yacht moored outside the hotel. It belongs to some sheikh who obviously took a liking to this part of the Lagoon and decided to moor just outside the hotel. The yacht was as high as the hotel and completely obscured the lagoon from the rooms at the front. Luckily, our room was on the side so we had uninterrupted views of the Lagoon and beyond. However, anyone wanting to take breakfast outside the hotel would have just had a view of the yacht - and this was not a pretty thing- more like a high-rise block of flats than an elegant schooner! The hotel staff made light of this monstrosity (had they been coached?) and we were not clear how often or for how long it moored there. Suffice to say, it was there for the 4 days we were there. If you do go to this hotel, check beforehand if the yacht is moored there. If it is, make sure you get a side room. The views are breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, just enough out of the way for a quiet stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ron064
Reviews.Content: Front desk people understood English and were very helpful in helping us select a good restaurant. Great location. 15 min walk along the grand canal to St Mark's Sq.. The young ladies that put our breakfast out were a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: LocusPointBaltimore
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The hotel is close to the attractions but, far enough away from the crowds. The staff is very helpful and provide excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DMM104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bucintoro for 3 night for our honeymoon. We had checking in and out of a hotel (immediately) in Venice after realizing it was a huge mistake as the room was just a box and we were on our honeymoon. I found Bucintoro had a room available and called. They gave me a special rate as it was their last room, which I imagine they wanted to fill and I couldn't say no. We took a waterbus there and were greeted by outstanding service and an excellent room. We had a junior suite on the 4th floor, which had 3 windows overlooking the grand canal and Doges Palace. The bathroom was luxurious with a huge shower tub and lots of room. There was a seperate seating and dressing area. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and were given a great little gem to go to, which was nice. We are so glad we switched hotels and we had a wonderful stay. It was great to be close enough to easily walk to St. Marks, but a little bit away from all the noise. The breakfast selection was great and you could enjoy it at one of the tables outside. We would buy gelato next door and come sit outside at one of the hotel tables and enjoy the scenery. It's nice to have some space. Thanks to Bucintoro, we had what our honeymoon should be.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel, beautiful views and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Fergal48
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room with exceptional views. The service we got was excellent. The hotel is located on the Lagoon about 15 mins walk from Piazza San Marco. Hotel Bucintoro is a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CheshireDancingqueen
Reviews.Content: Our experience of Venice was fabulous, the wonderful Hotel Bucintoro really was the icing on the cake. You have various options when arriving at the airport, we took the Alilaguna, a 1 hour boat trip virtually to the door of the Hotel, the only way to see Venice, by water all the way. Really easy to find at the airport, come out of arrivals, turn left, you will see a sign for â€œWater Bus Alliagunaâ€� in front of you, follow the covered walkway for about 5 minutes, just past the sign for Water Taxis (these do look great and are priced at approx 100 Euro per 1 way trip) you will see a large kiosk â€œAlilaguna Linesâ€�. To get the Hotel you will need the Arsenale stop on the Red Line, the cost was 13 Euro one way or you could buy a round trip ticket for 25 Euro. Worthwhile picking up a timetable at the kiosk, includes a good map as well as times. When you get off at the Arsenale stop, you are 2 minutes from the Hotel, turn right, over the bridge and it is there in front of you. You are not far from anything in Venice however we did really appreciate how little pulling of cases we needed to do, as we were so close to our Hotel. From start to finish the Hotel was fantastic, with a nautical theme throughout, the furnishings are of a high standard, wonderful dark would walls against spotless cream. When the porter took us to our room, he explained all the amenities and then with a final flourish opened the curtains â€“ the view truly was amazing! We realised as we wandered around just how lucky we were to have such a fabulous view. We stayed in room 402, a classic room with a wonderful double window that we could watch the world go by from. The room was great, not huge, however really well designed, the bathroom spotless, nice deep bath and good powerful shower, high quality toiletries and soft fluffy towels. Breakfast was amazing, fabulous cold buffet with croissants, fruits, cereals, various types of breads, cold meats, cheese, hard boiled eggs, cakes â€“ and really good coffee. At a supplement you could also have hot food. The weather for us was changeable, glorious sunshine and a fair bit of rain, the Hotel does provide umbrellas for guests and these were very welcome! Worth getting a vaporetto ticket for a couple of days so that you can see Venice by boat, so convenient! There are loads of restaurants around, it does depend on what you are looking for, watch out for the extras, cover charges can vary from 1 Euro per person to 4 Euro per person and at a lot of places a service charge of 12% is automatically added to your bill as well as the expectation of a 5% tip. We found a good restaurant that was packed out every night, their cover charge was 1 Euro per person and they didnâ€™t charge a service charge, all tips were at customers discretion - Taverna San Trovaso - 041 520 3703, From the Accademia bridge, head towards your right, walk down the first alley on your right turn left when you reach the canal. You'll pass the restaurant before you reach its entrance, keep looking back, we missed it first time. All in all a great stay. The Hotel was fantastic, I dread to think how much you would pay for a Hotel on the Grand Canal with limited views when you can have a luxurious stay at The Bucintoro with exceptional service, food, surroundings and of course views. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate in recommending this Hotel to anyone who was thinking of a stay in Venice. â€“ a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in all respects - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha777
Reviews.Content: The Bucintoro is in a wonderful position, 500 m from San Marco, on the edge of the lagoon . View from our room was over to San Marco on the right and the lagoon on the left. Tourists don't come this far, so the area is quiet. Our room was small but very clean. lovely marble bathroom with toiletries. Bed was too hard for us, but that's a personal preferance. Adequate selection at breakfast, which can be eaten outside, looking over the lagoon! Gentleman at reception couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Be careful - we paid travel republic Â£400 - but we could have paid the hotel 300 euros through their web site! Eat wonderful cichetti At Osteria al Pozzo Roverso Ruga Giuffa 4829 for only 15 euros. take the Alilaguna red line boat from the airport to Arsenale stop (San Zaccharia is easily walkable if that boat leaves sooner).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ljackson
Reviews.Content: You can't do much better than having a corner top floor room with the Talisker yacht serving scotch out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel! Great location for families.”
Reviews.Author: hmarti24
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms for our family at Hotel Bucintoro for 4 nights and we were not disappointed! The location and views are outstanding and the rooms are very nice, comfortable and clean. Venice in general is not stroller friendly, but the hotel location made it manageable. The hotel is a fabulous location for families as it is a short walk to a children's park and you are never more than a few steps away from great pasta and gelato! We will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the charm, location and rooms. Nicely furnished and fabulous bathroom, theview is just FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: maggieferrua
Reviews.Content: I loved the charm, location and the rooms are nicely furnished. The bathroom is fabulous, all marble and great linens. The water taxi dropped off just in front. The view of St. Mark"s Square is gorgeous. Wish we have stayed more than a night. If you like walking, you can do the whole city from there. We slept well, since it.s location is less crowded than hotels closer to St. Mark.s.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our 2 night stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelingterps
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us in several ways. The location on the lagoon provided lovely views, was an easy walk to Piazza San Marco and the Arsenale vaporetto stop, yet was relatively quiet and far away from the thousands of cruise ship tourists who seemed to be visiting Venice the same time we were. It was always great to arrive "home" again after a busy day of sightseeing! The decor of the hotel was exceptional -- with the marine paneling, spectacular marble bathroom with tub and rain shower, and quite comfortable firm bed. The service provided by the staff at the Bucintoro was outstanding from storing our luggage until the room was ready on the first day, to arranging a water taxi visit to the Murano glass factory (it was like a museum and we didn't feel pressured to buy at all), to answering questions, providing directions, and helping to carry our luggage over the bridge in the rain on our last day. And what a delicious breakfast we enjoyed every day - such fresh fruit, croissants, meats, boiled eggs....Thank you to all of the staff at the Hotel Bucintoro!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, good location & value”
Reviews.Author: TimPascoe
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Bucintoro - I was there last year for the Biennale. The hotel is small and decorated with a tasteful naval theme, wood paneling on the walls in the rooms. My first stay was in a standard double and this time in one of the junior suites - I would say the double would be perfect for a couple and the suite was better suited to a family that needed more space. Views are great in I think most rooms. Rooms/Bathrooms are impeccably clean. Breakfast is a buffet and very satisfying, hot food can be ordered but we never felt the need. Breakfast and drinks can be had outside the hotel to enjoy the sun and location which is very close to the main square but far away enough to be out of the potential tourist madness!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lagoon view and good staff”
Reviews.Author: LighthouseKeeper1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pleasant. We had a view from our room that stretched out towards St. Mark's Square and the lagoon and included beautiful sunsets. The decor is stylish and uses quality finishes. The breakfasts were fantastic--croissants, cake, coffee, an assortment of juices, meats, boiled eggs, cheese, and fruit. The staff working there were very helpful with directions and dining recommendations too. My only complaint was that our shower/bathtub didn't drain properly. We asked for it to be fixed and it never was so we had water past our ankles at the end of every shower and had to wait between each shower for the water to drain--not a major thing but also not really very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and a very nice family owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: saints2000
Reviews.Content: I actually used Tripadvisor to help me select the right hotel. Venice can be quite tricky to select the right hotel with some of the well known hotels being over-priced for what you get. We really enjoyed the Bucintoro hotel. The views over the lagoon are outstanding and the location is excellent less than 5-10mins stroll to St Marks Square. A walk that you simply can never tire of. The rooms are of high quality with a nautical feel and I dont think that I have ever stayed at a hotel as clean. It doesnt really have a restauarant but that is no big deal because there are plenty of options throughout Venice. I will definitely us this hotel again if I am back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money option”
Reviews.Author: PMateus
Reviews.Content: A snall hotel with a special atmosphere.... A great view to the grand canal, in the heart of Venice. A true value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: BigGMpls
Reviews.Content: For our first time in Venice, we chose the Hotel Bucintoro for our family of four (2 teenagers). We splurged for the family suite - a double attached to a twin with a small sitting area in between. It was so cool - since the Hotel is named after the boat of the Doges the decor of the hotel is nautical. The view overlooking the lagoon is spectacular! The staff was tremendous, helping us arrange dinners (difficult as we were there Easter weekend), transportation (we splurged for a private water taxi), and a trip to a wonderful glass factory on Murano. The location is perfect - on the lagoon a short walk to all the major attractions etc. but in a quieter part of the island. Our only criticism is the beds - too firm for our preference. But everything else was so great that it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Tripadvisor for the great recommendation”
Reviews.Author: pulu
Reviews.Content: Great location and great service I would recommend this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very Venice”
Reviews.Author: italstal1969
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro is located right at the entrance to the Arsenale. Great Venetian Navy museum next door...only a few euros for entrance and several stories high with many artifacts of the former Venetian Navy. The hotel itself is very clean. The staff are very helpful. Breakfast was continental and included with room excpet for coffee service. Actually, I prefer to pay a little more for the seperate coffee service as it very good, strong Italian coffee and they leave a small carafe at the table for you. I really like the rooms as they clean, have wood panels...very nautical in theme and have a very nice selection of toiletries included. The location, at the farthest end from the train station is excellent as you can watch real, working Venetians go about their nautical trades, deliveries and this end of Venice is where many Venetians live. There were several excellent small restaurants around the corner as well an ATM machine, Post Office, Bank and a convenient Vaporetto (water taxi) stop right near hotel. Lastly, Gian and his staff are very professional, speak English and very helpful. My wife and I plan to visit Venice again in a few years and we will stay at the Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view describes this Hotel perfectly.”
Reviews.Author: Hilsabroad
Reviews.Content: Hotel location great. Straight off the airport shuttle boat. A warm welcome. Clean well kept rooms. Lovely breakfasts. fantastic views. Buy airport transfer, public transport and museum passes in advance. It will save you time and money!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ralstonmom
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Bucintoro for New Year's Eve and Day to ring in the new year with family friends; also staying in the hotel. During our previous trips to Venice, we stayed in other hotels but chose Hotel Bucintoro based on TripAdvisor reviews. As always, the TripAdvisor community advised well. This was a fabulous hotel located perfectly on the waterfront and within walking distance to St. Mark's Square, in the Castello district. Our room, 501, was spacious, immaculately clean, and provided a terrific view of the Canale di San Marco and the San Marco district. The bonus for this room was the small rooftop terrace. Unfortunately, the weather did not cooperate for our trip (rainy and cold w/ aqua alta) but the terrace would be a spectacular feature during better weather. For a European hotel, I was pleased with the size of our room. We had a comfortable king bed with a single bed located in a small connecting space. The bathroom was spacious, by Euro. standards, and spotless. I booked our rooms on-line and the process was efficient. The staff of this fine hotel were professional and very friendly; always waiting with umbrella in hand upon our arrivals and departures. The breakfast buffet, included with the room fee, was plentiful; featuring pastries, fresh fruits and meats, hot dishes, pastries, and fabulous coffee. There is a small but comfortable business room with complementary internet service. The bar area, where breakfast is served, is open for cocktails or coffee throughout the day. If we return to Venice, we will certainly return to Hotel Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: Gabi07
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 day trip to Venice. We stayed at Hotel Bucintoro, which I had chosen based on the good reviews in Trip Advisor.. and all I can say is.. it was all so true! The hotel's location is absolutely perfect.. only 10 min walking distance from St. Markus' square and very close to the next Vaporetto stop. We actually walked from Arsenale to Bucintoro, and even with 2 large suitcases (and crowds of people) it didn't take us more than 10 min either. However, even though the location is central and we had a beautiful view on the sea, it was quiet. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the breakfast.. is one of its kind in Italy! Overall, a fantastic hotel! We'll definitely come back. Thank you mille grazie for making this visit so unique and enjoyable. Gabi and Dennis

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location, super views of the Grand Canal and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: billmarywedding
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff were very professional, friendly and helpful. Lovely room with Canal view and easy walk to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely hotel.. just the right distance from Piazza San Marco.”
Reviews.Author: Lulabelle21
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for 6 nights we stayed in a Junior Suite with Lagoon View. The room was very spacious with good sized bathroom, and had two windows overlooking the Laguna. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be there were no tea making facilities in the room.. something we have been accustomed to. We did ask for a cup of tea in the lobby dining room late one night and were surprised at how expensive it was!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: crazynaomi
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I've stayed in, and to top it off, one of the best weekend getaways/mini-holidays of my life (due to the hotel). The staff here are incredible, educated, and very helpful. The rooms are wonderful, the bathrooms excellent, and the view, breathtaking. It's but a small 6 minute walk from St Marco square, and the Vaparetto stop is right out the front! Above all, it's around the corner from the beautiful public gardens, and many museums. The staff are extremely helpful in eating at wonderful local eateries rather than tourist traps, and because they're personal friends with the owners of the trattorias, the service is fantastic! Everything about this hotel was fantastic, and the experience is one of the best I've had travelling. I'd highly recommend this place to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, good service, good location..what more do you want!!”
Reviews.Author: Aido23
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, within a 10minute stroll of St marks square which is far enough to be away from the hustle and bustle but not too far, with plenty of places to eat/drink nearby even if most of are a bit touristy..Our room was smallish but sufficient and well presented with a view of the lagoon. We got the best deal (â‚¬150 per night B&B) on their own website with their 'Winter in Venice package' and booked via their website. Breakfast is typical hard boiled eggs, fruit, meats and bread rolls, it gets you going for the day and you can have the fry up if you really want but its costs a bit extra. Not sure overall I would pay the the full rates which were ~30% higher but I suppose the rest of the year the place is so busy they can ask whatever they want. Head off to the area around Rialto Bridge for some great Italian restaurants and wine bars that serve wonderful food at very reasonable prices..Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot near enough to everything”
Reviews.Author: donchaplin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days to take in the Munster V Treviso rugby match with my partner. Hotel is very easy to find if taking the water bus from the airport. The guy on reception was very efficient and the porter was a very friendly guy altogether. Room was spotless with a lovely view of the lagoon, could have been a bit larger but it was fine. They seem to like heat in Venice as you could nearly have fried an egg in our room so the windows were open a lot, which is an awful waste of energy. Aircon is only available in the summer months apparently. Breakfast is basic enough but what is there is fine had to wait about 15 minutes for a table one day which I though was poor enough (thus deduction of one point for service). It is a very easy 5 to 10 minute stroll to St. Marks. We enjoyed our stay there and if I were to return to Venice again for a holiday I would have no quams about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pac57
Reviews.Content: We would not consider staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced 4* within easy walking distance of St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous174
Reviews.Content: Hotel appears to have been renovated to 4 star standard relatively recently - it appears in older travel guides as a 2 star. Worth shopping around for the best price. The Junior Suite that we got was not big but it was sufficient. Views are impressive.

Reviews.Title: “It is a very friendly and cosie holtel”
Reviews.Author: Yenisha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice at the beginning of December. We found the hotel via tripadvisor. Overall it is a very nice hotel: great service (most stuff there are very friendly and helpful); clean and cosie room with nice style, but the room is a bit small; the location is pretty good as well for sight seeing, but it is a longish travel by boat to the hotel (it is the last second stop with boat line 1), beside of that it is pretty easy to find and from the hotel you will have a wonderful view to the sea and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, a very comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ngates
Reviews.Content: Strongly recommend this place. Booked through Expedia for three nights over new year, had a great room with views down the Riva Schiavoni to San Marco, room a little on the small side but that's a theme in Venice! Hotel staff very friendly and efficient, and room maintained to a high standard. Breakfast also very good. Location could obviously be closer to the main attractions, but it's a pleasant stroll (less than 10 mins) along the waterfront to Piazza San Marco and you're less likely to get lost on the way there or back - that's a big plus. The Arsenale vaporetto stop is also minutes away, so it's easy to get to from the airport. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: luke_ad_murphy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were lucky to travel to Venice over Christmas and stayed at this hotel for a few nights. It's about a 10 or 15 min stroll fom San Marco Basillica and therefore a great location just slighlty away from the main hustle and bustle. The hotel is clean, tidy with good facilities but above all it is VERY well run. The staff are very attentive and friendly, the breakfast is good too! Above all it is the attention to detail that makes the place so warm and welcoming; that umbrellas are made available if they expect rain, that the reception staff suggested a wake up call for us to catch a ferry without us having to ask them. It was a few small things like this that really made it a great place to stay. I'd like to thank them for help making our stay in Venice very special!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service, great view, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: denverCO13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Bucintoro during our stay in Venice this winter. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We were led to our room on the 4th floor with an amazing view of the lagoon and St. Marks. The hotel is 200 steps from the Arsenale waterbus stop or a 7 minute walk from the St. Mark's/San Zaccarias stop. Easy. The hotel is near the naval museum and takes on a modern naval look with its deep, rich brown wooden interior and accents. Beautiful. The room itself was very comfortable, with a large (for European standards) bathroom, slippers, towel warmers, small flat screen TV and in-room safe for your valuables/passports, and a queen size bed. The location of the hotel is a 8-10 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. It is right on the water and just off the tourist path which is nice for a quiet room at night. If you are going to Venice, you should plan on doing some walking (obviously because there are no cars) and if you want to really enjoy the place, you need to explore all parts of the island. We had a great stay in Venice and loved the Hotel Bucintoro!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jesseCamogli
Reviews.Content: Beautifully detailed interiors, great location - central and just 100m from Arsenale vaporetto - lovely staff, luxurious and with lots ofpersonality!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great service”
Reviews.Author: scatch1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in November and were very pleased with the hotel. The room (junior suite) was smaller than we expected but it was very clean with a great bathroom. Nautical theme added to the experience. Came with the usual comforts of a 4 star inc. toiletries, mini bar, small seating area. View from the window was exceptional, looking straight at the lagoon. Approx. 6-7 minute walk from St. Marks square. Breakfast was very good. All fresh and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Bucintoro!!”
Reviews.Author: OB_170
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how lucky my partner and I were to find this hotel! It was absolutely incredible. The staff were lovely and were more than welcoming upon our arrival. The bags were taken for us and we were shown around the room. When we got into our room the curtains were opened by the bell boy to present the view from our room (I will note it was night time) and the view just blew us away. We both were speechless. The room was beautifully kept and after a day of walking and seeing the sights we would come back to a tidy room prepared for another night. Heck, even the sweets were replaced! There is a little 10 min walk to Saint Marks but I loved it, the views were incredible so I was happy to walk along the edge and stare at the lagoon. I would certainly recommend people to go to this hotel. The way I travelled was by gettin the standard bus number 5 to Piazzale Roma and then getting the number 2 water bus to Saint Marks. Had a nice walk to the hotel admiring the views on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful sights on beautiful nights”
Reviews.Author: CiaoVenice
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with beautiful views of the lagoon and the city from each room - lovely to watch the city comes to life as you enjoy the fine breakfasts. The staff are courteous, helpful and always to hand, but never intrusive - nothing is too much trouble from answering questions to providing services.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and great service”
Reviews.Author: kite777
Reviews.Content: Small but really thoughtfully fitted double room with great views down to San Marco. Really convenient for the Biennale Giardini and Arsenale locations and vaporetto. Service was impeccable and the breakfast delicious. Alilaguna waterbus (linea rosso) from Marco Polo airport also stops at Arsenale so only a very short way to carry your bags to & from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and fabulous, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: geebLondon
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after viewing the positive reviews on Trip Adviser and the fact that it looked like a hotel in which I was confident of getting a great view at a reasonable price. We weren't disappointed. It could hardly have been better. It was just a short walk (less than 200m) from the Arsenale Vaparetto stop so took only 1 hour 10 mins from the airport by Alilaguna Linea Rossa. Our room on the second floor, for which we had paid a supplement for a view, was wonderful and the view which took in St Marks, The Salute and San Georgio Maggiore could hardly be better. The room was small but it was perfectly kitted out and the bathroom was a master of getting a lot into a little space (including a bidet and a bath with rainfall shower and handheld shower). Everything was extremely clean and worked well (except for the mirror light). The staff were all very charming and spoke English well. The buffet breakfast was fantastic with choice of different sorts of coffee (Capuccino etc), fresh fruit salad, cereals, yogherts, hard boiled eggs, hams, pastries etc. You could also have an omelette etc made up for you for about 5 Euro. I really can't understand the experience of a recent reviewer which gave this hotel a bad review - either he has abnormally high standards or it was part of a cunning plan to keep the hotel to himself! While we were in Venice we experienced Aqua Alta which meant that the area around St Marks was best avoided around high tide unless you wanted to join the slow procession behind a convoy of assorted tourists balanced on the walkways. However, on the good side there was no problem at the Buchintoro and for most of the day the walkways gave an opportunity to sit and eat your ice cream in relative comfort without paying a cover charge for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, amazing sunsets, impeccable staff”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We are all in search of value these days......the hotel is beautifully situated and perfectly located near the giardini, near enough to san marco and tourist sites, but far enough to escape at the end of the day-just in time to watch the sunset while enjoying a spritz. The staff is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable with great restaurant suggestions and the perfect sounding board. Gian Maria is especially wonderful...... The room was nice and clean, but could have been bigger for 2 guys over 6 feet tall. Next time i would request a corner room with bigger windows.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah05
Reviews.Content: A really excellent hotel. The location was ideal, just a 10 min walk away from St Marks Square and only 50m away from the Arsenale vaporetto stop. We could have spent all our time just looking out at the view from our bedroom window. We had a lagoon view and we could see all the way up to St Marks and the Grand Canal - it was really breathtaking. The only down side was that we found the room rather warm and there was no individual air conditioning control, so we ended up by turning it off completely. The hotel was clean, well-equipped and the staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. There was a good variety of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirehornet
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of reviews of the Bucintoro on TA we decided to use it as our base for our 3 night stay in Venice and we weren't disappointed. The hotel was immaculate, staff incredibly friendly and the rooms, although a little on the small side, were very comfortable with everything you'd need. The location of the hotel was also great - far enough away from San Marco to be able to get away from the crowds but only a 10 minute walk if you wanted to do the main sights. The vaparetto stop directly outside was also very handy. It wasn't cheap but compared to other hotels in a similar location was excellent value for money. Next time we come to Venice we'll definitely be using the Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very comfortable hotel in a peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: DavidGNB
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean and modern rooms that captured the martime character of the hotel and surrounding area. An excellent location, just on the edge of the crowded centre (10-15 min walk to St Marks), which gave us the opportunity to relax and enjoy the scenery and atmosphere without being disturbed by the hordes. Room 501 highly recommended - a really special treat as it comes with its own roof terrace. The service from all the staff was without fault for the duration of our visit. We won't hesitate to stay here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Book in advance and reap the benefits”
Reviews.Author: dividendo
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time in Venice and we wanted to stayed in a different area. This was a top notch choice. Terrific location, 10 minutes walk to St Mark and the water taxi from the airport will leave you 10 steps away (be ready with 100 euro). Complete breakfast included (make sure you select this option when making the reservation). Friendly staff. Great views to the canal and the city. We booked 3 months before and paid around 265 euro for a superior/corner room. Friends wanted to book 2 weeks before and the bill was close to 600 euro. It pays to plan in advance...

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Radaconsultants
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We were fortunate enough to be given the top floor with a balcony which has a view to die for. Our unit number was 501 which had the necessary amount of romance to compliment our special occasion, being our 25th wedding anniversary. Separate bedroom, lounge, bathroom and stair case. It was special. Just when you thought that was it, well onto the balcony and watch those cruise ships sail you by, then you think, how good is this and what a shame I am only here for one night. The hotel is conveniently located to a sea taxi stop which makes it easy to go anywhere in Venice. To Piazza San Marco, it is only a 5 to 10 minute walk. Even though it is close to these facilities, I experienced no noise or overcrowding which can dampen you experience. Shops and restaurants are all in close proximity as well. As is the case with most hotels in Venice, area is a premium in common areas. Which made the size of our room even more impressive. The staff is caring and willing to assist in all areas. As I was able to speak Italian to them, we quickly developed a relationship even though we were leaving the next day. The daily rate could be considered as higher than normal, but I understand that is the case for all hotels within Venice. If you are looking for a treat and a wonderful experience, you can not go wrong in choosing this hotel and room number 501.

Reviews.Title: “Its true - 5-Star service... in a most romantic city”
Reviews.Author: Son-of-Poochmas
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor never fails... appreciate and concur with the other travelers observations. Pricey $340/night for this beautifully decorated boutique hotel. All rooms face the Grand canal - island of San Giorgio and are named after sailing vessels. Impecabble cleanliness... All rooms decorated in wood/brass in "stateroom style." PROS: - exceptionally good concierge service with a can do attitude (arranged trip to the Dolomites at a moment's notice) - gave us toiletries when our luggage failed to arrive - 10minute walk to St Marks - very good breakfast (included) - nice little business center with internet with cool music CONS: - none ! would avoid the trip to the New Murano Glass factory. The hotel arranges a 'free' trip to the island by taxiboat. The salesman at this venue are pushy..and there is nothing you could hope to afford here unless you have $25,000 Euros to burn. This is an excellent hotel which is really a 5-star venue (no gym or restauarant). You will not be disappointed. Very clean and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in the best location.”
Reviews.Author: LGBScotland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro is a fabulous hotel. The location is the best in Venice: only 10 minutes walk from St Marks but a wonderful view of the lagoon and the Grand Canal from the rooms and the seating area out front where you can watch the world go by. It's a great base for exploring the city as the Arsenale stop for the vaporetto and the airport waterbus is very close by. The room and the hotel was exactly as we expected from their description and images on their lovely website: clean and simple with a hint of luxury. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful with local knowledge on restaurants, shopping, etc. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was delicious and served with smile. We booked direct with the hotel through their website which was a simple process and got confirmation back soon after. It's a gem of a hotel and I'm so pleased that I won't have to trawl the internet looking for another one the next time we're in Venice - we'll go straight to the Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view . . . perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: We began our trip with extended family in Venice. It had been years since I had visited this miraculous floating city and this time I was not disappointed!! The hotel is situated just two foot bridges away from the main square and the views from the top floor of the hotel (where we stayed) were really unbelievable! We had two rooms in the hotel with a roll-away in each for our children. Even with that, the rooms were still quite functional and the dark wood decor made one feel as if you were on one of the anchored yachts right outside. The breakfast was "typical Italian" with fresh juices, pastries, and made to order cappuccinos. The staff were friendly and accommodating . . . helping with baggage and reserving water taxis. In Vencie, it's difficult to find a hotel of this value. I would HIGHLY recommend the Bucintoro!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, extraordinary views, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Mishkacat
Reviews.Content: I brought my girlfriend to Venice for our engagement, and was well-pleased with what we found with the Hotel Bucintoro. We selected the Junior Suite (Lagoon view), and the description didn't do the view justice. From the bed, we could easily see the Campanile and the Santa Maria della Salute through the windows in front of us, with San Giorgio Maggiore visible through the side windows. The bed (two doubles pushed together) was clean, comfortable, and well-arranged. Plenty of closet and bathroom space, with a clean shower/tub. I slightly downgraded the location, only because it is slightly out of the way (as you can see on the map), but the surrounding neighborhood is charmingly quiet, and the Arsenale vaporetto is a bridge away (2 minute walk). The slightly-removed location allows you to look out over the southern coast of the island, and so I would say there is more advantage than disadvantage to the location. The service was friendly, non-intrusive, and attentive to requests - I will call out that they did not have an iron available to borrow for the room, but they did provide a same-day ironing service for a fee. In total, I would not venture to stay anywhere else in this price range - the value is exceptional for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and impecible service”
Reviews.Author: TandLColorado
Reviews.Content: Great stay, great staff, great food, lovely room with views of the castle and city (#42). Can't wait to visit again. Highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Great location, BUT!”
Reviews.Author: capitalstraveller
Reviews.Content: We've watched this hotel emerge from the old Pensione which preceded it, with much interest, and this year decided on a ten-day sojourn, to coincide with the Regata Storica - tip here: if you plan to see this pageant in future years, go to the VeneziaSi office at the Ferrovia or P. Roma - we didn't and were too late to get reserved seating, so our views were scant and uncomfortable! But we did get to the Biennale and the Lido film festival! We stayed in room 404 on the top floor of the hotel, a splendid room with windows on two sides, so unrivalled views. BUT:- on two nights there were noisy events on the Riva below, just about tolerable for us, but very noisy for those in lower rooms! And cruise ships and large gin palaces moor outside the hotel, creating further disturbance: Also, the ground floor of the hotel is very small and rather cramped: the brochure shows outside tables under awnings, but use of these has apparently been banned, pending further planning reviews? So the outside seating is only useable if the weather is right! The staff, particularly Andrea, Sheila and Edith, were very helpful, and it's difficult to fault this hotel for a first-time visit, but more experienced travellers who know the views might prefer somewhere a little less 'vibrant'?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexWadders
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay in this hotel over the Bank Holiday weekend. The staff were so helpful (especially Andrea who suggested restaurants that he eats in and told us to shop around for gondola rides as they do vary in price). The rooms were clean and had plenty of hanging and drawer space, with a safe and mini bar. The bathrooms are all marble and have hairdryers and plenty of toiletories. We were lucky enough to have been upgraded to a Junior Suite as this was our first visit to Venice and we had wonderful views of the lagoon and St Marks Square. Every morning we were woken by the smell of freshly baked rolls and croissants. Breakfast is a self service buffet, but there was a wide choice of fresh fruit, cake, rolls and jam, croissants, cheese etc. Each day we ate outside the hotel and watched the locals running (are they mad with all though bridges?!), walking to work and we even saw some of the cruise ships come past. While only a 15 minute walk to St Marks Square the hotel feels far enough away from the hustle and bustle to escape in the afternoons to recharge your batteries before setting out again. The hotel is a short walk (over one bridge) from the Arsenale water bus stop. This does take an hour from the airport but only costs â‚¬13 per person one way or â‚¬25 per person return, compared to â‚¬95 each way for a water taxi. Although they do only run one an hour. We decided to get the water bus down the Grand Canal (costs â‚¬6.50 per person per trip, but if you intend using a lot may be worth getting a 24 or 48 hour pass). You get to see so much more from the water without the cost of a gondola, although as it was my birthday we did this too which was unforgettable! We found it quite expensive to eat in a restaurant at lunchtime so we found shops that sold pizza and calzone from outside and just bought this and walked around eating (like the locals do) about â‚¬3.00 for a big slice of pizza. We both loved Venice and would love to go back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and not in the main Tourist element”
Reviews.Author: Peter_afc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for a three night vacation and having reviewed the Hotel on trip advisor I was comfortable that we had made a good choice. The location was about a 15 minute walk from St Marks Square made longer just down to shear numbers of people in the area, The Hotel offers wonderful views of the seafront/marina and the rooms are themed on different boats and are spotlessly clean with all of the usual falcilities but ours was a little on the small size but no problem unless you intend to spend a trip to Venice in your bedroom! The breakfasts were great and you could sit outside or inside weather dependant of course. A continental style but lovely freash rolls and fruit as well as cereals and eggs.The staff were very helpful and will provide good advice on trips and restaurants and will book trips and reserve tables for you if ask. In summary a great hotel for the money and no complaints at all. Only problem we had was that we were on the third floor which is great for the views but the lift broke down whilst we were there and was out of action for two days. This would have been a problem for older people or disabled but not for us, although hard work onmce you had spent the day walking around Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: AintDunRoamin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bucintoro was the perfect location for our Venice honeymoon. We could see the hotel when we got off the ferry (and this is very important when you are carrying luggage!) AND it was close to Piazza San Marco! The room was absolutely beautiful; the staff was extremely friendly and helpful; and the included breakfast was as delicious as it was bountiful! We loved the experience and would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but well located”
Reviews.Author: DaithiMac01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October 08, and were pretty happy with it apart from one gripe, see below. The location is pretty good, it is not absolutely central, but for that in Venice you really need to splash out. It is about 10 minutes walk to St. Mark's square, buit more importantly it is right beside the Arsinale Vaporetto (Water Bus) stop, so it is very easy to get to by boat. The rooms are quite small but are well laid out. They attempt (and succeed) to emulate the feeling of a cabin, with the furniture and port-holes for windows etc. If you want a large expansive room then they are not for you, but hey you're in Venice so what are you doing staying in your hotel room??? Our room had a pretty impressive view overlooking the main Venice harbour and St Marks, and I have a feeling from the way the hotel is laid out that this would apply to all the rooms in the hotel. The breakfast room is also small, but we never had to wait for a table so perhaps it is adequate. The cold food available on the buffet is pretty good and they do have cooked food to order, which I did on the first day, but it was not great so we stuck with the buffet after that. The major gripe we had was one which will probably not affect most people but I mention it for completeness. It was unseasonably warm the weekend we stayed there and the rooms were very hot and clammy. However the management refused to turn on the air conditioning stating some policy regarding the time of year etc. This was quite annoying and would be one reason I would hesitate to use this hotel in winter months again ... presumably in the summer it would be OK. I also don't know how unseasonably warm it was for Venice, it didn't seem that warm to me for Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff, top ratings”
Reviews.Author: Nandy5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bucintoro with a family of five: two adults, three teenagers. The hotel is a small boutique hotel right on the canal but in a quiet part of town. It is close enough to the sights but in the morning having a coffee outside overlooking the magnificent boats it is surprisingly calm and quiet. The rooms are small by US standards but magnificently appointed and the bathrooms are luxurious. Andrea at the front desk was wonderful and inviting. The hotel is an excellent choice and thank you to Tripadvisor for helping us find it. This is a definate choice and highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “When in Venice, definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: Delmonico73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after much research on Trip Advisor. Couldn't beliveve my eyes and the reviews. It lives up to both. Location on the Lagoon(fantastic vista), 10 min leisurely stroll to San Marco(away from the hordes) , right beside a shuttle stop so no lugging bags over numerous bridges. Rooms are immaculately clean & well presented , free internet access and excellent staff, with a special mention for Michele, who couldn't do enough for us. I cannot sing the praises of Hotel Bucintoro highly enough, to the extent that some of our friends have already stayed there on our recommendations. We look forward to going back some day soon.....

Reviews.Title: “would stay again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: CaseoftheTravelbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 week trip to France & Italy and this was one of our favorite hotels while abroad Positives location - walking distance to action but in a quieter area very friendly staff free wifi access breakfasts view from hotel room was spectacular Negatives The hotel room was small but was still functional would stay again for sure and would definately recommend the hotel to all our friends and family. Holly & Jeremy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: sandjf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bucintoro has lived up to all the reviews that we have read. The hotel is ideally placed, close to the main attractions but just far enough away to be peaceful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Andrea was always on hand to offer his expert knowledge of Venice, giving us lots of ideas for places that locals would use. Everything about the hotel is bellisimo. The sight of an ocean cruise liner passing close to your bedroom window is a sight to behold. We look forward to another visit in the future. Thanks everyone at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, charming, I wouldn't go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Salento12
