Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd trip to Venice and for the first time I have felt like home rather than one in a million tourists. Since the beggining over the phone the amazing Andrea at the concierge convinced me that I had made a good choice. He was a "real Venician" very proud of his marvellous city and he told us where to go for dinner or for a gelato or for a simple coffe, the only difference from other experiences is that he sent us where he would have gone among locals, in charming places out of the mass tourism business. The hotel itselfs is awesome, small, clean and with a great attention in every details. It seems like to be in an old cruise ship and we loved it! It is just 10 minutes from San Marco but at the same time just next door to a real Venician neighbourhood. The continental breakfast was also very good and generous. A special mention to Andrea again for making our stay so special and to the Bucintoro staff and management for taking care so well of this beautifol hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view in one of the world's most beautiful cities . . .”
Reviews.Author: WeekendEscapeeLondon
Reviews.Content: . . . what more could you want? I fell in love with Venice many years ago yet returning each time I struggled to find a hotel which matched its style and magnificence. The last two trips (and all the future ones) I was fortunate to stay at Hotel Bucintoro. This is my idea of heaven. High speed taxi from the airport across the lagoon. Friendly, smiling and ultra professional staff waiting at the hotel. Cooling off in a sunken bath and stepping out on to a sunny terrace with spectacular views across the canal of Basilica di Santa Maria della Salute and Isola de San Girogio Maggiore. Close to St Marks but far enough away to escape the hubbub and momnets away from Giardini for the Biennale. I can safely say Hotel Bucintoro is perfetto!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MediaProf
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay at the Bucintoro on the sole basis of the positive Tripadvisor reviews. What an excellent decision that turned out to be! The hotel is just a ways beyond the hustle and bustle of the St. Mark' square area as you re heading into the Arsenale area. The rooms were spotless and magnificently appointed with dark hardwood, brass accents, flat-screen TV, and wonderous views of the lagoon. The bathroom was full of green marble and high-end decor. The bed was a bit too soft for my liking; however, I generally prefer a firm bed, so I may be overstating things on that point. Andrea, the hotel manager, was a delight (as others have mentioned). He was a proud Venetian who took a personal interest in my visit. You could tell he cared a lot about the hotel and the guests he was servicing. He recommended a non-touristy restaurant and a few sites off the beaten trail that I would not have seen otherwise (and I have been to Venice several times previously). All hotels should be lucky to have a person like Andrea representing their hotel. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SCSLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bucintoro to celebrate my 40th birthday and I was extremely pleased with our choice. The hotel is in an excellent location just a short walk from San Marco. Our room was on the corner of the building and so we had views out over the lagoon and also along towards San Marco. The room was very well sound-proofed so there was no noise from outside and, although it was quite small, it was nicely decorated and very clean. There were just some minor things that weren't perfect like not enough hangers, no mirror apart from the one in the ensuite and a lack of hooks but, as I say, these are all very minor niggles. The breakfast was fine but pretty basic fare and was the same every day. It was, however, replenished constantly by the very pleasant and helpful waitress. The other members of staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful. We were in Venice the weekend of the Redentore and chose this hotel specifically as it had a view of the lagoon and we were looking forward to watching the fireworks from our room. Unfortunately a large boat was moored in front of our window for the whole weekend and obscured our view. Obviously the hotel cannot be held responsible for this, but it's just something to keep in mind as even once the Redentore was over other boats moored in the same position. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel which we booked through Otel.com at around 120 euros per night, which is very good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I was on a dream cruise...but wait it was a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: therobe71
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bucintoro was definitely my partner's and I favorite hotel during our trip to Italy for our birthdays. The interior was designed like a cruise ship with hard wood walls and marble in the bathroom, it was done in a very elegant finish, not cheesy at all. The attention was great, and I was impressed how the staff have traveled and new Cuba where my partner's originally from and they spoke many languages. We loved the outdoor restaurant/cafe outside the hotel for breakfast in the morning and drinks at dusk. The breakfast was wonderful with fresh pastries, croissants, etc, and the bar serves from great capuccinos to Sprits the drink of Venice during the Austrian occupation. Anyway you think I work for them, but I loved it. We had Room 303 with a view of San Marco and a great yacht, like the one I plan to own one day. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: honest reviewer
Reviews.Content: I chose this lovely hotel based on prior reviews and I completely blown away by the whole experience! Upon our late evening arrival, Andrea, the manager on duty, arranged for a friend of his to open his restaurant just for the two of us. That was the first display of generosity shown towards us amongst countless others. From the housekeepers to management, this hotel is a gem. Although Venice is easy to see during a short visit, I would return just to experience this hotel and staff many times over. They cannot do enough for their guests to ensure their comfort, we are truly grateful! Andrea, Boston Celtics (Larry Bird) shirt, will be to you soon, we promise. Thanks again for a remarkable time!

Reviews.Title: “Stop your serch now!!!”
Reviews.Author: falabalam
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel for my girlfriend's 30th birthday...who became my fiance during our stay too!! Cannot recommend this hotel enough-the location is unbeatable-waking up to the lagoon every morning simply takes your breath away. The entire building is spotless, and the staff cannot do enough for their guests. I don't normally write reviews, but made it my priority when we got home...just book it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel very close to everything but out of San Marco craziness.”
Reviews.Author: tjoneser
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our Italian vacation, and it was a great way to begin the trip. I had booked a Jr. suite w/a Lagoon view which was so amazing. The rooms were very clean and new, very comfortable, and again, I really wanted a room with a view and this was great. We were a short walk from Piazza San Marco and I'm so glad we didn't book a hotel closer to the action because that area got VERY congested and touristy. This hotel is further down in front of Arsenale bus stop, so you can easily catch a water bus (vaporetto) up thru the canal. Or you can walk everywhere, which is what you do in Venice (and Rome and Florence). Staff was very friendly & helpful, free internet access and breakfast every morning. We really liked this hotel and would stay here again. On our last night there were fireworks right in the lagoon in perfect view from our windows, as if all for us, I couldn't have thought of a better way to cap off the last night in Venice if I'd planned it myself!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: yazz_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Hotel Bucintoro last year. I had written a review about it before but not on trip advisor. I have to say that i am so glad that we chose to stay at this hotel during our visit to Venice. The hotel is perfectly located. It is just a short enjoyable walk away from St Marks and sits right infront of the lagoon. Each room has a perfect view. However it was not just the location that made it special for us. The staff were incredibly and genuinely hospitable. They always went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. The hotel was clean and beautifully decorated and the breakfast was also really nice as you could dine outside infront of the lagoon. This is a small hotel and the staff here have a personal touch. Michele and Andrea were amongst the two concierge that made our visit to Venice so special. However every member of staff at this hotel treated us with unforgetable hospitality. I would love to visit Venice again and if i do i would love to stay at Hotel Bucintoro.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view and breakfast by the boats”
Reviews.Author: sightseer15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from Venice. We took a long time to choose our hotel and this certainly paid off. The location of Hotel Bucintoro is just right! Not too far away from St Mark's square but a couple of bridges away from the very busy stretch. The room was clean and modern and had fabulous views of San Maria della Salute, San Giorgio Maggiore and St Mark's Campanile. The hotel is directly on the promenade of the lagoon and the plentiful breakfast can be taken outdoors. There is a good ice cream shop just yards away and the local shops / bars on the Via Garibaldi are not as touristy as elsewhere. The staff were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Hotel for a Venice trip”
Reviews.Author: Doc_Fester
Reviews.Content: During our short stay (2 nights) we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Bucintoro in the centre of Venice. Everything from the helpful service to the beautiful rooms made our stay very special along with possibly one of the best hotel views from our window across to St Marks. Although centrally located right on the harbor it was quiet and very relaxing. A very clean Hotel and immaculate throughout, I would highly recommend the Hotel Bucintoro for anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend the Hotel Bucintoro to family and friends!”
Reviews.Author: 6familytravelers
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality accomodations at The Bucintoro Hotel - it turned out to be the perfect hotel for us! We had two rooms, both newly decorated with picturesque views of the Venetian waterways. It was an easy and scenic walk to Piazza San Marco and excellent restaurants. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We enjoyed the delicious buffet breakfast in the charming breakfast room and outside on the patio.

Reviews.Title: “This small quaint hotel is a fantastic find. We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Harttravels
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Hotel Bucintoro and would only stay there again. The hotel itself is absolutely beautifully decorated with a fantastic location. The room was very well appointed with gorgeous hard wood floors throughout. It was extremely clean and the room view of the grand canal was great. The best part was that being a small hotel the staff was very attentive and gave us excellent service. They were extremely kind and helpful. My luggage did not arrive on the plane, and the front desk staff of the hotel took care of contacting the airport and tracking it down for me! They even followed up after we left to be sure the luggage was delivered as the airline had promised! (I highly recommend traveler insurance for lost/delayed bags). Internet use was easy and I think included-We had our own computer. The breakfast was light and simple with the European necessities-fruit, coffee, croissant, cheese, spreads and pastries. We were so happy our travel agent recommended this hotel. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Top class view and location for economy price.”
Reviews.Author: princesstrio
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned from a wonderful 4 day stay at the at the Buccintoro Hotel for our first wedding anniversary. We booked the Hotel mainly because of the View. Our room cost about 220 a night and the same view in the metropole or Danielli would run you 600 euro a night The location is perfect, just a 5 min walk to st marks, but away from the throngs of people. When we first checked in we were shown to a small room with a shower only,and small windows......as all the info id read on the rooms had stated ,with a bath, we returned to the front desk and were very kindly shown to another room. 202. wow wow wow!! Not only was the room bigger ,but it had two huge double windows which opened right out. We used to sit in the window at night drinking wine and porsecco and admiring this wonderful view, so although there is no Balcony, this was just as good. The Hotel is small yet nicely done and breakfast is basic, The staff are kind and gentle and the service faultless. if you want a more luxurious wow style place then stay at a 5 star, but be warned you will not get the view. we shall be returning to this hotel again and again I hope. Also this hotel is a 2 min walk to the most amazing Reataurant with tables next to a canal Hostaria Da franz, please try it or chcek my review on this also.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bf238
Reviews.Content: Quiet and comfortable place with extremely kind staff. They were always ready to help with very usefull local advices. We had a room on a corner with view on both the laguna and the town : Wonderfull. The hotel is about 5-10 min walk from San Marco and very close to the non-touristy Venice (Via Garibaldi) where the real good italian food is. Apart from the price (expensive but worth it...) the Hotel is PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “We where stunned about the beauty of the city venice and the beautiful hotel bucintoro!”
Reviews.Author: erosronny
Reviews.Content: For our next visits in venice we will book always the hotel bucintoro, again and again, and again,.......... etc. The kindly stuff (especially mr. michele and mrs. veronika) and the beautiful rooms from the hotel are a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: BB_Zurich
Reviews.Content: Classy, beautiful setting, amazing views. Highlight was the breakfast on the terrace facing the lagoon. Strictly nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Ian019
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Bucintoro after a somewhat fraught journey to find the staff very helpful and concered about our difficultis. Our room was modern, very comfortable and had a beautiful view over the bay. The hotel is small and I beleive most or the rooms have this view. The hotel is situated near a waterbus stop and is in easy walking distance of St Marks Square. There are many small shops and resteraunts in the visinity. Unfortunately the hotel does not have a resteraunt and only serves a lovely breakfast. The thing I thing we both liked most was the staff who made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: rio de janeiro\ paris / new york
Reviews.Title: “very lucky choice”
Reviews.Author: jfgiuliani
Reviews.Content: We picked the Bucintoro after reading reviews and descriptions on the web: We hit it lucky. It turned out to be the perfect place for a perfect week long stay in perfect weather: Location is great, close to the center and San Marco but away from the more crowded parts and close to a major vaporetto stop. The service was excellent and we particularly appreciated Michele`help in booking our room. He was great; he and his colleagues were at all times friendly and helpful in picking restaurants and advising on visits and itineraries. The only problem we had was with our shower which was complicated to operate and poorly designed ......but the Bucintoro is a treasure and its staff is the greatest. Thank you Michele & all your colleagues, not forgetting Jacopo ! Arreviderci to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “For us the best hotel in Venice! Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaHolland
Reviews.Content: Our room was incredible, very nice and friendly staff, excellent view from our balcony overlooking Venice while enjoying our breakfast. A recomandation to all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PAG66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two week trip to Luzerne, Lake Como, Venice and Tuscany. We cannot say enough positive things about the Hotel Bucintoro. Its staff, particularly Michele, its location, the beautiful way in which the hotel was completey redone, reopening May, 2008, after one and a half years of complete renovation, its location, are all outstanding. The quality and attention to detail of the renovation are excellent. The view from our room was gorgeous. The "cold" breakfast buffet very enjoyable. In all, an outstanding hotel and wonderful memories from our stay. We chose the Hotel Bucintoro as a result of the TripAdvisor reviews and would (and will) definitely recommend it to friends. We also would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelotter01
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in April, and had a wonderful time. Arrived late at night and staff were very cheerful and helpful, and even recommended a place to get a bite to eat that late. We had a beautiful corner room with views of the lagoon all the way to St. Mark's Square. As others have said, ignore the purse sellers on the bridges, and you can walk anywhere in Venice from this hotel, then come back to a relaxing room away from the crowds. Breakfast was very good and lots of choice. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again if we go back to Venice. Check their website in advance and you can get reasonable rates for such lovely rooms. Best place of our 8 day trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Charming house with high value for money”
Reviews.Author: JaneMunich
Reviews.Content: From the outside-view Hotel Bucintoro is not the most very eye-catching house, but this impression is wrong. Not only the location is perfect (10 minutes walk to marcus-place), but also the interiour (based on the interiour of a yacht), cleanliness and the plaesentness of the staff. Staying at this hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel right on the lagoon”
Reviews.Author: SarayCT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 12 days in Italy and stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Bucintoro. The hotel is easily accessible from the train station by vaporetto Line 1 (about a 35 minute ride up the Grand Canal) to the Arsenale stop. Just one bridge over is the hotel (ignore the guys selling knock-off handbags on the bridge). Great location in the quiet Castello neighborhood (good restaurants around the corner) and also directly on the lagoon with perfect views so you get the real feel of a laid back Venezia. It is close enough to all the hustle of Piazza San Marco (approx. 10 minute walk) but far enough away to escape it. We were traveling with our daughters (9 & 11) who also loved the hotel. We stayed in the funky, cozy roof-top suite (501) which we loved, with the private terrace. (Warning: interior stairs, so this suite wouldn't be a good choice for families w/ really little kids). What a view from the terrace (2 rattan chairs & table) and a really different way to experience Venice. The kids enjoyed watching the boats come & go and each day a giant cruise ship would get tugged right past us. Crisp, clean, nautical touches and clever design of small spaces -- you really feel as if you're on a ship! Staff was incredibly accommodating and pleasant, especially Michele, who was a sweetheart and gave us good tips for nearby restaurants, grocery store, etc. Complimentary water taxi to Murano for a glass factory tour (no obligation to buy) was also a nice bonus. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but we felt it was worth it and are used to NYC hotel prices. Be sure to ask about the restaurants around the corner (over 1 bridge)... and one night we even just ordered a pizza to take out and brought back to the hotel. There is a nice outdoor space in front of the hotel w/ tables to have breakfast, drinks, etc. Breakfast room inside hotel is well appointed w/ complimentary drinks, pastries, rolls, meats, etc. A small gelateria right next door, too. We hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Well located - beautifully appointed hotel with exceptional service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: MontrealFancyPants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bucintoro for three days and the service was exemplary - we had the pleasure of having Michele Constantini as our concierge and he went well beyond the call of duty to make our stay pleasant and enjoyable. Fabulous place with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful hotel experience anywhere......exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: CanadaThumper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, there were 6 of us and we all enjoyed everything. The rooms, the food, the location, the service was exceptional especially Michele, he is by far the most helpful, friendly, happy, knowledgable concierge I have ever come across. Thank you so much for making our trip so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place to enjoy a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: GILL028
Reviews.Content: the hotel is charming, easily accessible from the airport - only one bridge to go over. The staff were very helpful - especially Michel. the rooms were delightful we were lucky and had corner rooms which gave spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: 1stTriptoItaly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights in Italy recently. Three in Rome, two in Florence and two in Venice at Hotel Bucintoro. We stayed in some nice places along the way but Hotel Bucintoro was simply the best of our trip. We will definitely stay again when we return to Venice. We highly recommend Hotel Bucintoro! The faciltiy is terrific and the location is even better. Very near the Arsenale water bus stop, on the bay, clearly marked and easy to find - which is a big, big plus when traveling in Italy and especially Venice. Look at their website. Pictures and description are perfectly factual and accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Made the trip”
Reviews.Author: treyeden
Reviews.Content: We had read earlier reviews of this hotel and decided for the price and comments to stay at this place. We found a very nice hotel in a good location that meet all our needs. My wife and i and mom and dad both had Junior suites on the second floor. Not the biggest rooms we ever stayed in but very clean, with great views and amenities. It was not to far from St marks and dont forget to go to castella (out of the hotel to the left) where you will find a grocery store,gelato, restaraunts that locals attend and even a place that sells wine by the liter in plastic bottles for 2 euro. If we ever come to venice again, we wll stay here. Hope to get the rest of our family to stay at this location as the walk to anywhere is not that bad . Andrea at the front desk gave great recomendations and the breakfast was always a treat with god fruit , danish and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: WestAustraliaFreo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice and we couldnt have asked for a better hotel. Centrally located, with wonderful views but easy enough to get away from the crowds to the district of Castello.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small 4 star hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: SandKPlymouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approx 500m from St Mark's Square and within 2 mins walking distance of Arsenale vaporetto stop. Our standard room had fantastic views across the lagoon. The room itself was clean and the service excellent. An unexpected benefit was the free use of internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: kazumdc
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive research for a hotel, we decided on this one. It surpassed our expectations. The rooms were nice and the entire place was spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was very good as well. We got our best price by requesting a price on their website. The response was timely and we had it booked within an hour.

Reviews.Title: “excellent locality”
Reviews.Author: alex200643
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good location, excellent view from the rooms, new equipment and delicious food. We are very thankful for Michele Costantini for organization of our trip and his kindness and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room with a stunning view”
Reviews.Author: Olly9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite for 3 nights in early February. Even though the weather was cold, wet and windy on the day we arrived, the welcome couldn't have been warmer. This hotel is a real find and we've recommended to several friends already. The rooms are not huge but they are cosy and woody making the place feel ship-like, though not overpoweringly so. The hotel's big selling points are: 1. the location and stunning views - from a corner room out across the lagoon and also towards St Marks. 2. The warm abnd attentive service. 3. The attractive and well-appointed rooms. 4. Good breakfast - cold buffet but eggs etc available extra to order. Bucintoro is not a vast hotel with a busy bar and public rooms: it's a friendly, attractive and well-run base for a visit to a stunning city. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “the best stay in Venise”
Reviews.Author: pascalNice
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel centrally located facing the Laguna. rooms are very confortable and furnished as cabin's ship. all hotel team is really nice and full of attention. i am a travel agent and i am very harsh critic, but i will recommand this place without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel on the entire trip”
Reviews.Author: tommco
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice during the middle of Carnavale. Compared to the prices of other places we had considered staying, Bucintoro had a very favorable rate so we went for it. I was a little apprehensive because the pics looked so good that I was thinking maybe there was a catch. In all honesty, it's one of the few hotels that looks better in real life than the pics on the internet. Aside from the charming mahogany-trimmed rooms and the wonderful view we had, the location was superb -- a 5 minute walk from St. Mark's square, but not in the center of tourist mayhem. We were delighted that the area in the opposite direction of St. Mark's seemed very non-touristy by comparison, and found a good restaurant in this area favored by locals that was about a two minute walk from the hotel. The staff at Bucintoro was super-friendly as well, so we were 100% pleased with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: misora
Reviews.Content: It was a bit difficult to find in the beginning, as the instructions from the hotel was to get off at st.marc's square. But in fact we had to walk quite a bit (about 15 minutes with our luggage) before finding and arriving at the hotel. Venice's hotels are quite small in general, so comparatively, the size of this hotel was adequate. Rooms were nice and clean and the reception was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DollyDollyDolly
Reviews.Content: First off, the location was superb. You are about 10min walk (max) from St. Marks sq and there are many water bus stops that will take you anywhere in Venice. Nearset stop it right outside (Arsenale). (P.s . if your planning on getting to the hotel from Marco Polo airport get the water bus. Its 13euro p.p and takes an hour but the jounrey isnt too bad. If you miss the bus or dont fancy being with other passenges, the only other alternative is a water taxi. this will cost you 100euros though!!!!!!!!!!!!!) The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms had a great view of the city and were very clean. I stayed in a double room. The room itself is beautiifully decorated. The only real minor complaints was that the room was a little small (not much floor space) and the room doesnt come with coffee/tea making facilities. The fridge also didnt keep the items cold (maybe ours didnt work?). Also, if you are planning sleeping in all day, the TV channels are poor, especially if your english. No sports channels lads! Only BBC24 and MTV. The bathroom was massive though and very well decorated. We got complimentary slippers and bathrobes which my dolly (girlfriend) was very happy about!! The breafast which was included was good. Had choices of cereals, rolls, cheeses and yougouts (typical contiential breakfast). If you want eggs, bacon etc you would have to pay extra. The hotel however does not have a resturant for the evening so you have to dine out. Be warned, the resturants are very expensive, especially if you like your meat and fish!! The hotel also has the internet. Overall, i would definately recommend this hotel. Its not as expensive as some of the other 4* and 5* hotels we saw and looked at and its location and decor is excellent! Great success.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Bucintoro”
Reviews.Author: Ozhoneymooner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly rated on TA and other websites and for good reason. This is a top notch 4 star hotel in one of the most beautiful city's in the world. Hotel Bucintoro is conveniently located in Venice. We arrived by train and it is a simple 30min Vaporetto ride to Arsenale stop, the hotel is 100m from this. This is a lovely way to start your trip in venice as the number 1 Vaportto goes all the way down the grand canal and out into the bay. The hotel is less than a 10min walk to St Marco square and from there you can easily explore the rest of Venice. The front desk staff were both very helpful with everything from choosing restaurants to organisising a trip to Murano island to check out the glass making. They even organised a free taxi boat to the island for us. The rooms are designed with a nautical theme which were very nice. All rooms have great views of the bay. The bathrooms were also very modern with great amenities and a nice deep bath. Complimentary in room wifi internet unlimited and free or computer in the lobby if you don't have laptop. Breakfast included was continental but very ample. All in all this hotel was excellent and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: MDuser12
Reviews.Content: I just spent five nights in Italy with my girlfriend and started out with a two night stay in Venice at the Hotel Bucintoro. I booked the hotel through otel.com at a great average rate of only $190 per night which was lower than anywhere I found on the web. I booked based on excellent reviews on TA and the property's good location. Also the price was reasonable for a luxurious place. Our flight landed at Treviso airport at nearly 9PM and by the time we arrived at the hotel it was after 11. The man at the front desk by the name Andrea was extremely friendly and helpful. I asked if there was anywhere to get something to eat as it had been over six hours since we last ate. He called his girlfriend at a nearby restaurant to see if we could still be seated even though it was closed at 11. We were shown to our room and then walked a few minutes to the restaurant for a salad and a pizza which was quite nice. The place was full of locals as well! The service throughout the stay was excellent as we received helpful info on restaurants, transit etc. Also I was impressed that I was always addressed by last name. Our room was 303 and was very nice. The bed was large, and as is common in Italian hotels a bit on the firm side. The bathroom was of a nice size, had a good shower and contained good amenities. There were a good amount of TV channels including BBC and CNN in English. There was even an Italian sports channel which was airing the NFL playoff game. Lastly the view of the Grand Canal and St. Mark's was lovely! We ate the compimentary breakfast each morning which was pretty good. It consisted of some cold meats, cheeses, croissant and spreads, fresh fruit, cereals, juices, and a good coffee bar. Also they had eggs, bacon, etc. for an additional charge, however their standard offering was plenty sufficient. Another thing that I appreciated was the essentially unlimited complimentary internet access on a lobby computer. I only used it for a probably 30 minutes but it was great to have the ability to use it for longer (unlike the hotel I stayed at next in Rome). Finally, the location of the hotel was great. It was about 250 feet away from the Arsenale vaporetto stop (when getting off there simply turn right and cross the bridge and you will see the hotel soon). In addition you could easily walk to St. Mark's in under ten minutes. From there many sights are within easy walking distance. Lastly the area is much quieter and less touristy than those closer to St. Mark's, yet is still close enough to the touristy areas. The only negative (and its a minor one) was that there were loads of men selling knockoff purses near the hotel and along the walk to St. Mark's, but this was really not a problem, just thought I'd mention one negative. In conclusion, this hotel was a wonderful place to stay in Venice. Our visit came in January which was freezing, but also made for cheaper hotel prices and much less crowded sights. Do try and get lost and just explore the city as it allows you to truly be. Hope you found my review helpful and enjoy your trip to Venice. I'd love to go back again and would absolutely stay at Hotel Bucintoro again!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful December”
Reviews.Author: Matt002
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the most amazing weekend in Venice and are so glad that we chose this Hotel. It enjoys a central location for getting to all areas of the city easily.Our room on the top floor had the most amazing panoramic view towards St. Marco and over the waterfront. The staff were welcoming and friendly and we felt totally at home. Our room, while compact, had all mod cons and underfloor heating in our en-suite bathroom was a delight for tired feetafter a busy day sightseeing.It was good to visit at this time of year rather than in the summer , to see the place in a different light. One of the pleasures is wandering through the less well known areas and coming on unexpected sights. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and hope to re-visit in the future

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel in a great position with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: happyjaunter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Bucintoro and had a fabulous Junior Suite on the 2nd Floor. The room was comfortable , quiet , had superb views and everything worked perfectly. You had neither noise from outside , nor from other guests , cleaning staff etc . Breakfast was substantial and the weather was good enough to eat outside .The hotel's position is very convenient , for both walking and a nearby vaporetto stop , whilst being far enough away from the genreral throng. The staff could not have been more helpful and all were charming and pleased to be of assistance whenever it was required.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: oneforone
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all: great location, fabulous waterfront views, outstanding service, high quality rooms, more than satisfactory breakfast, a small boutique hotel feeling, and all for a fair Venice hotel price. Hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a nice view”
Reviews.Author: Zoom123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bucintoro from October 8 until October 11 2008. We choose this hotel based on the reviews here and elsewhere, and based on the fact that all rooms of this hotel have views to the lagoon. We were not disappointed. The room was small but nice and the staff extremely helpful. The views from our window were great as well. During our first night we had a problem with the sink which was blocked and the water was going down very slowly making it very difficult for me to shave since I had to turn the water on and off constantly to prevent it from overflowing. We didn't say anything about this problem because our time in Venice was limited and we didn't want to bother with it. The next day, however, the cleaners probably noticed the problem when they came to clean our room and they fixed it. This clearly shows how all the staff of this hotel, from the reception to the cleaners, care about the reputation of their hotel and they will do all that is necessary to maintain their good name.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gagouli
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 15th of September till 17th, 2008. Hotel is located in a perfect place not noisy and in the meantime 5 minutes walk from San Marco square. The Vaporetto (taxi boats) station is approx. in front of the Hotel so it is easy to take your luggage to the Hotel from airport or train station. The receiptionists were so friendly specially Michele who assisted us always with a smile. The breakfast was good and the coffee was not from the coffee machine, they served you fresh coffee. Our room was so big with big bathroom and a beatuful view of grand canal. We recommand this hotel to every one who wants to visit the beatuful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miceluxury
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel located not to far from the centre San Marco but in a quiet area which was suitable for us. Great rooms, bath room and breakfast. Front desk staff was attentive

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Ums
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel with my partner 13-17 August 08 and thought it was excellent. We got the Alilaguna ferry from the airport to the hotel (12 euros per person as opposed to a private taxi which was about 95!), Sadly we missed the Allilaguna ferry to the Arsenale stop (which is virtually just over a small bridge from the hotel and only about 5 mins to walk), and instead got one to San Zaccaria - this wasnt too bad at all as it was only a 8 minute wak (although there were a couple of bridges which we had to carry the bags over). The location of the hotel was really good from that respect, with the walk to San Marco only taking about 20 minutes lesiurely stroll along the canal. When we arrived at the hotel, it was about 11:30pm and the chap behind the desk welcomed us by name, He then gave us a map of venice, a little guide book and also told us the weather for the next day (a nightly thing when you collected your key). He then personally showed us up to our room. The room was on the small side (e.g. no desk) but very good. The view was fantastic looking towards San Marcos. Facilities inside the hotel were also very good (toiletries, decent hairdryer, etc). Breakfast was very good too. We normally sat outside and people watched whilst we dined. There was fresh fruit, bread selection, cold meats, cereal, etc, On one day, the chap recommended a trip to Murano, the glass blowing island. He arranged a private water taxi over there free of charge (a special thing as the hotel had just opened apparently), This proved to be a really good trip and made a nice change to the main island. On our last day, our flight wasnt until 9:30pm, and they let us keep the bags at the hotel after checking out. No complaints and would definately recommend it.
